2SGauhai5E5r6V0pFgiuYA.text: Love this place! great sushi, great service, great price, never too crowded and clean. i'd rate it 10 stars if it was possible. go here, support this business because they rock!

A25dgVw1qbEYv5gFPy8TUA.text: Worst service we have ever experienced!!! Second worst sushi we have ever eaten! Normally we go to Zenshin or Oyshi! However it was my Moms birthday we decided to try something new... Biggest Mistake!!!   We checked it out before bringing my mom, and met with the chef and owner ( who claimed he worked at yellowtail in the Bellagio and Nobu at Ceasars we love Nobu so decided thus was the place for moms birthday dinner! Bonus the Chef seemed very nice!  When we arrived 5 adults & 2 toddlers we were hungry and excited, however we met with the two worst servers!!! They were extremely rude, unfriendly, and lacked knowledge they also never checked on us after our first order ?? We had to leave our table three times to request food, drinks, and get this our check!!! Don't worry they didn't forget to charge us a 20% gratuity charge!   After two hours of sitting we left hungry and spending just under $200.00 with no dessert for my mom or any of us!! Because although green tea cheesecake is on the menu the server said it was not available today they were sold out at 6pm and no business?! Okay make it up to us with some ice cream... 1/4 scoops with fingerprints actual finger prints!!!!  On our ice cream so disgusting!!!  Thankfully we went to cream at downtown summerlin after for taco Tuesday and as always they were great! And saved our day!

kkA2WQI9Qt0SVm2KEKIMHw.text: Honestly the best sushi place I have ever been to. Its cheap for all you can eat, great sushi that arrives within less then 10 mins, and all the staff members are really nice. Only complaint I had was that the waiter didn't check on us, I had to grab her attention but granted they were a little busy. So if you love sushi this place is the way to go!

1ILq5QaMPoOrTFwGWRTgVQ.text: Before I begin I would like to add a disclaimer to my personal review of this restaurant. By no means am I trying to pick on any particular individual with this review. This review is based on my first time experience to eating at this restaurant.  Cleanliness 1 star  Ambiance/decor 1 star  Food quality 1 star  Customer service 1 of 2 stars  Over all this is a good place for those who love AYCE sushi. The modern look and family style seating are very welcoming when you first walk in. At a glance of the whole restaurant the level of cleanliness was more than acceptable. Quality of fish used for the sushi was hit and miss. I was served on a couple of occasions some sushi that didn't look fresh and didn't taste fresh either. Food quality for the rolls was good. Now for the customer service I experienced wasn't the best. To give some background I worked in the restaurant industry for 3 years. I know when the major rush of customers come in to restaurants. To avoid the rush and enjoy the experience of eating sushi I chose to come in on a Saturday mid afternoon. I was literally the ONLY person there at the restaurant. I was greeted by a waitress almost immediately which was great. I enjoy sitting at the sushi bar to interact with the sushi chefs as they are the experts. Unfortunately this is where my experience went south. The sushi chef catering to me was not as friendly and very short with the conversations I would try having with him. I felt rushed with ordering sushi when I just started eating a roll in front of me. I kept getting rushed and kept getting asked what else I wanted when I wasn't even finished with what was in front of me. It became somewhat uncomfortable. I heard someone say hello and it seemed to be the manager or owner as their communication/people skills were very good. Unfortunately due to the poor service I felt I was receiving from the sushi chef I was too poor in a mood to really interact with this gentleman. The waitress definitely was kind and made sure everything was ok with me. Aside from that, my personal opinion on the sushi chef attire was very poor. Using baseball caps and inconsistent attire reflected in the attitude. The worst part of this experience is that I was the ONLY person there. Never have I felt so rushed when eating sushi. To make matters worse I got tired of getting rushed so I told the sushi chef I was done ordering. Next thing I know the chef pulls out his phone takes off his cap and goes sits in a corner. I have to give a real review of the restaurant so it will stay at 4/5 star ratings. If I was rating on customer service alone. This review would have been a 2/5 star rating.

S_OW3JFd0DWVznKtxK0BkA.text: So delicious. The service is super fast and attentive. The menue has tons of sushi selection and the All You Can eat is a great value. The Mona Lisa roll was my favorite!

Thank you to the staff of Hanabi, as a restaurant manager, I'm very satisfied!

qRRNLMiQFRwyvcT8a01NeQ.text: I've been going to this sushi place for a couple of years now, but the last time I went will be the last time I ever go there. I was unable to finish the meal I had already paid for... and I come to find out there was a fish bone lodged in the back of my throat. Thanks to my friend who suspected it was a fish bone, my sister, after many minutes attempting to take it out, finally was able to pull it out of my throat. Due to this experience, I will never return to this sushi restaurant again. The attached picture is of the fish bone after having been removed.

8lRspRANhkPn_1v9nCATww.text: I'm happy to say that there is new sushi bar in town which has a great all you can eat option. Luckily we were passing by on their first day of business so we decided to give it a try! I was originally just looking for some appetizers to snack on but the all you can eat dinner for 28.00 seemed pretty reasonable so I went with the all you can eat.   I started with the Kobe beef sushi roll. It had Kobe beef, avocado and a sweet type of sauce drizzled on the top. It was delicious!   The crispy buffalo shrimp was tangy . They were bite sized shrimp with buffalo flavoring.   The 007 was like a California roll but with big pieces of shrimp and avocado draped over the rolls. I enjoyed these as well!  Bacon and scallop skewers were mostly bacon with tiny pieces of scallops inside. They had different skewers available . I would like to try the bacon and mushroom skewers next time.   Chicken Katsu wraps were good especially for people like my husband who don't eat sushi. He was happy with the wrap and his cucumber salad .  We ended the meal with some honey toast. It reminded me of hawaiian rolls with ice cream and honey on the top. It  was my first time having this dessert be prepared for sweetness overload!  I liked the variety on the menu and that there wasn't a lot that was left out of the all you can eat. Except for the sashimi but it was okay with me because I don't eat sashimi. I thought the picnic type of chairs were cute and comfortable. The service was on point and I can't wait to go back. My husband even found something he would like to try on our next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Hanabi Sushi and Rolls - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe beef rolls

VYUcGxBHjuMFOwQfoYrYUA.text: Called 6 ayce places in Las Vegas and each were out of uni with the exception of Hanabi Sushi. We came in and were immediately seated. There are about five waiters who you can order from. The sizes and proportions allow you to try many items off the menu. The fish is all very fresh and their unique sauces make this place a great try. We will sure be back.

Tried the : Shrimp popper, Salmon Special, The Hanabi special, my absolute favorite roll was the Crispy rainbow i love the combination and sauce.   I also tried the salmon poke and tuna poke i personally did not like the seaweed in the poke.   For dessert i tried the Honey Toast it was good, The bread was nice and chrispy but it's just hawaiian bread and vanilla ice cream with honey.   Just a reminder fellow yelpers the umm 8.01 discount for Ayce has expired. Idk if they just have not gotten around to taking that down or just smart business lol ;) Either way give Hanabi a shot!

zJ7Nn6pnmp6EPXWDcxAHog.text: We love this place. It's now our go-to sushi restaurant in Vegas. They have a new menu, and it's amazing how many appetizers are on it, and of course their sushi is fresh and delicious. I love that they don't have a lot of rice on the nigiri. They have the standard rolls and some like Sunrise/Sunset, Hanabi Special, Blossom, and the sashimi specials - the seared salmon is my favorite. The uni has always been good, and I love getting the oysters. I usually ask for the udon soup without the noodles because I really like their broth. We've tried almost all of the appetizers, but be careful since the portions are large, you might get stuffed. It's the only place where Korean bulgogi is on the appetizer menu. All the items on the menu except for ramen is part of the all-you-can-eat. In our opinion, it's one of the best made-to-order all-you-can-eat places for us. I think we average 8 visits a month here.

PtM5q6LqNft3ElQPZpkLTw.text: Delicious fresh fish.  Good udon.. The rolls were absolutely fresh. This is a well priced ayca place that has exceptional service. Waitress spoke English and was very prompt with her service and any of our requests. My wife and I really enjoyed it!

MmNArcAPfRM3deqVEMjPvA.text: One of the best run restaurants in Vegas, no bullshit. The first thing I noticed walking in was Andy, the executive chef, walking around to each table, making an effort to know each of his guests. The setting is very clean, and modern, yet nice to sit down and have a drink and some sushi whether you're by yourself or with friends. I tried a Japanese stout which I didn't even know existed until I came here. It was so nuts I had to try and was not disappointed.   The sushi was great. My favorite was the salmon roll which consisted of cooked salmon. I normally prefer the raw condition, but the sauce and tempura coating really pulled it all together. I also enjoyed the panko roll, which was nice and crisp but full of sushi goodness.  All of the servers were on top of their game, friendly but not obnoxious. Definitely coming back here frequently.

Last night a friend and I decided to check it out, and it was one of the best sushi experiences I've had in awhile. The staff was beyond friendly and Andy, the owner, was so delightful! We tried the White House roll, Baked Salmon, Coco Shrimp, Softshell Crab, Poke Tuna, and Oysters. This menu was definitely worth it for the AYCE price. The quality of the food was excellent, even better than most places in San Diego! I'm definitely coming back here.

Au_7tlLaooNsf5A6Gnh2jw.text: I think I might have found my new favorite sushi spot! Hanabi is located in Village Square right by Archie's and Cold Stone. It's a little bit small inside, but nicely decorated. It has a very modern, urban feel.   Now for the best part, the sushi.. OMG. So good! Our favorite roll was the Coco Salmon. The salmon literally melts in your mouth and the coconut flavor is just right, not too over powering. Definitely 5/5. Our next favorite was the Sunset roll. I could not get enough of the creamy sauce on that one, another 5/5. The final roll we got was the Mona Lisa. This one was still very tasty, but a little bit too much cream cheese for me. I'd have to say 4/5. The ginger salad was also tasty. It was pretty standard, but a large portion size.   I cannot wait to come back here again and try out some more rolls. Honestly the best, freshest fish around!

W39Fm6zNT_tZkuPdQ5dTQA.text: Loved everything about Hanabi! We were greeted warmly by a friendly employee. Our server was extremely nice and made sure our table was always clean, and glasses full. PdE9OIMnU2me0v5GOznYVw.text: I've been to my fair share of sushi restaurants all over the valley, but I'd have to say Hanabi tops them all.  First off, the staff was so friendly... everyone from the servers to the owner/chef Andy.  * Fish was super fresh * Great selection/variety of items on their AYCE menu (rolls, appetizers, sashimi, entrees ... and a whole lot more).  * Portions were perfect (they don't try to stuff you full of rice). * Rolls are unique and flavorful --- and their assortment is quite impressive.  I tend to like rolls that are not deep fried or filled with shrimp tempura on the inside (Most AYCE places only have a few rolls that are not fried) However.  at Hanabi I had more than enough to choose from and everything I tried was DELISH!  Amazing experience all around ~ and the best sushi bar in Las Vegas HANDS DOWN.

sgCkhkgOZTaDPeXdaJSNLw.text: Wonderful service. Good food. Sushi is as good as the places in California. The fried soft crab was delicious. Oysters were juicy. Ordered a salad and it was huge. Anyway, definitely will recommend this place to friends!!!

3b6j_rKk2xDmkwE5R4-Ijw.text: Where to start..My fiance and I go to a lot of sushi places. First of all, the customer service was on point.  The food however not so much. Don't get me wrong the nigiri we ordered was good despite the slight confusion we had looking and realising there were 2 slices of blue fin tuna on each piece on rice. No complaints though as the fish had a decent taste. Everything that followed was hard to choke down. Stay away from the spicy tuna nachos. I'm talking a spicy tuna glob in the middle of fried wonton "chips" smothered in a yuck yuck sauce. Thank goodness for the hot tea to wash down that hot mess. The rolls were bland and lacked any unique twist other places have. Total fail trying a new spot. Never coming back.

aaCVjU_KPdcoUI0qfUQTWw.text: Amazing sushi, especially for somewhere that offers all you can eat. The staff is super friendly and accommodating. The rolls were delicious and creative, but the sushi was also top notch. I haven't found many all you can eat places that include raw oysters. Their weekly specials were also interesting and delicious. I had a fatty tuna sashimi that was absolutely mouthwatering and it melted in my mouth. They had man vegan options which was nice for my friends who normally don't have much to choose from at sushi. When i came it was my birthday and the staff sang and brought me a dessert. Everyone was super sweet. The service was quick. Great place to grab dinner. I will definitely be back.

mVd0XjutF42UlnMQzRBUOg.text: Checked it out for dinner with friends since it was the closest AYCE sushi spot. I'm on the fence about this place. For now, I will give this place a 3. It wasn't the best, nor was it the worst. Just meh.  We were acknowledged and greeted promptly as we walked through the door.  The restaurant was loud, lively,  and was about at 50% capacity for a dinner time. Not too bad. We informed the hostess there was three in our party and lead quickly to a 4-top. I went to the restroom to wash my hands and came back to my party with only place settings and menus for two..  I corrected it myself by grabbing from the table next to us. Aside from that little hiccup,  service was quick and they were attentive. I never had to ask for a refill on my beverages.   Pricing was good for an AYCE. $24.99. But very confusing. Why put on Yelp! that to check in the price is $24.99 when the price is already that to begin with? I thought the draw for businesses using Yelp! was to for an incentive for visiting their establishment?  My qualifications for an AYCE restaurant are very minimal:  - fresh ingredients, mainly their uni and amaebi - is their salmon skin hand roll actually crispy and mostly salmon skin? - do they have natto? - do they carry fresh wasabi?  Their uni was very fresh. Firm and no bad aftertaste. Same with amaebi. The downside to their amaebi is the puny size and no tempura heads to accompany the nigiri.   Their salmon skin hand roll should really be considered a salmon handroll as there was more salmon than fried skin. Taste was fine and as always I forget to ask no eel sauce. I'm very picky to menu items; don't list something if it's not what you are presenting the guest. While we are on this topic, please don't say that you have soft shell crab on the menu and only give half of the soft shell crab. I understand it is only 1 per guest on AYCE, but at least specify it's half of the soft shell. I'll gladly pay for a full crab.  Natto was not on the menu from what I saw, but they did carry it. Down side, they were out! I get that it is a Tuesday and they were closed Monday, but it's a Tuesday... deliveries should have been made to compensate for a busy weekend if they were running low, so that was a let down.  Seeing as they were not up to par with my necessities for sushi, I opted to not inquire about fresh wasabi.  Dessert menu offered the nornal sushi staple: tempura ice cream and mochi ice cream. Nothing made the desserts stand out or scream out.  But definitely willing to give them a chance again.

l0-2xQ17CbXHjsbvJiO8Qg.text: This place is awesome. It is always sparkling clean and the staff is incredibly friendly, eager to help. Often times the owner is on hand and he loves to meet and get to know his customers.  Well they're sitting at tables or at the bar you will receive fantastic service every single time. I love their nigiri options, and their roles are also fantastic. They recently started offering tonkatsu ramen which I cannot wait to try. I love that they offer fresh oysters. The authors are huge and absolutely scrumptious and come served on ice with lemon. We love the simply shrimp, crazy caterpillar, loco mojo, and red rock rolls. Customizations are available upon request.  We here frequently with friends, probably once every two weeks. We love the consistency we always know what we're going to get when it comes to quality. When it comes to sushi surprises aren't always a good thing.  During my birthday week we came here tonight's in a row because it that good. Hanabi is one of our favorite sushi restaurants in the city and we will be back time and time again.

C_hdUzYndp-at4pS7tNoqA.text: This is one of the best sushi's restaurants in vegas - nice atmosphere, Ashley made sure we will have the most amazing time.  I will recommend to arrive here during the evening with your family or just with your wife for a fun easy going evening.

From the AYCE menu make sure you look on the chalkboard for their specials!!! The yuzu yellowtail is BOMB. We live five minutes away and this is a go to!!!

sPVzrP6D9aMfKb_n_sfOLg.text: Very friendly server! However, super expensive for what you get. $25 for ten pieces of Sashimi, and that is all you get- not even a miso soup or house salad for that price. My roll was plain and terrible house wine. yT3PahlHKY2kdj4WSG1-Mg.text: I'm actually rather disappointed in my experience here.  I was super excited when my brother and I sat down.  Especially since the service seems to be great at the very beginning.  The waitresses were very kind.  But it was like a train wreck.  Through the entire experience, they forgot what we order, gave it to the wrong table, we had to re-order.  It was a hot mess.  My brother and I honestly gave up.  We did the AYCE special for $20.  We were there for about an hour and a half, literally an hour was us waiting for our food that never came.  Which honestly was REALLY annoying.  There were even times when the entire staff was arguing because a to-go order was misplaced.  Honestly, the entire experience was so bad, I would NEVER come again.  The reason why I gave it a two instead of a one is because the waitress were honestly nice people.  The entire overall experience was TERRIBLE.    I would comment on the food, but I can't even remember eating anything because they barely gave us anything.    Spent $50 on sushi, ended up getting a front-row seat to a live reality TV on Korean workers' drama at a sushi restaurant.  I usually go to Drama Fever for me Korean drama, but I guess not this time.

2PuArzIKqKFg4XtESylnXQ.text: Pretty modern and cool little sushi spot. My bf and I sat at the bar, which was very clean and the staff was very attentive. Surpsingly they were attentive all the way to the end, unlike most sushi places who ignore you after your third order. The blue fin tuna and scallop nigiri were my favorites. I also like how they offer other dishes on the ayce menu such as curry. Kinda disappointed in their oysters though:/ they did not taste fresh and there wasn't any sauce with it. Sushi selection was very generic as well. Honey box toast and green tea cheesecake were good.

VsLyuQ9U11TZ8NDBCQO6yQ.text: I love the service and attention. Sushi quality is good not great. We've been a couple of times, here are my suggestions they need in order to gain a loyal following.  1. The all you can eat option has far too many restrictions, just raise the price and limit the restrictions to a few things. Or put those on a separate page of the menu.  2. Stop threatening to charge for uneaten portions under the all you can eat. Portions are so small I doubt it's a cost issue.  3. Delivery of food items gets very slow after the initial order, if that's intentional then stop it. It's very noticeable.   4. Portion sizes of just about everything are the smallest I've seen in any sushi restaurant in Las Vegas.

otQ4oaqRGtVfyvi8IoHgtQ.text: 10/10 Very good! Definitely a favorite that we will visit again and again. We're satisfied and content from appetizer to dessert! Service is quick and attentive! QzPDGqFybNZOHfazbJD73A.text: This place is great. So good, I went twice in one week.   Last Saturday, my friend and I were meeting in that area of town for lunch and to get piercings. We were both ravenous, so AYCE sushi was the obvious answer. I checked Yelp and Hanabi had fabulous reviews. We are around 4:30 in the afternoon, and the place was empty. But that just lead to an amazing experience. We chose to sit at the bar and the ladies who manage the bar were prompt, polite, and gave great recommendations. When I went for myself second visit, we sat at a table, but our experience was just as good. Our waiter was so nice, gave great recommendations, and even let us get away with using our one per person to order two of the same thing for one person.   When it comes to food, everything was so fresh, creative, and the presentation was amazing. Their sashimi was the perfect portions and they have lots of non sushi items too, so this place is great if you want to check it out with a non raw fish eater. You have to try the Sushi Bomb roll, the Sunset roll, Animal Style roll, and the Mona Lisa Roll. The CocoSalmon roll was also very creative and good.  This place is a hidden gem in Village Square and if your a fan of delicious flavor, you should check them out!

yxXUl9uaPH7irgNq3VHmtA.text: Hanabi is a hidden gem in Village Square. The chefs are very friendly, and the fish is some Of the most fresh I have had in Las Vegas. The lunch special is awesome, only $20 for AYCE, and has very few restrictions. The Miso Soup, Pork Belly, and salmon are MUST HAVES. also, the super white tuna is served with a drizzle of sesame dressing that is fantastic!!

Po9yb4IoOM5YwQxCW5AVug.text: Best quality fish Best quality service Best quality price  Andy, the owner of Hanabai personally took the time to meet my family. You can taste the passion and care in every piece of sushi.  And $22 for AYCE lunch time! What a deal! If no one told you it was 22, you would think the meal costs triple that. How can you tell? Because Andy use to be a senior executive chef from NOBU!  Hello! How often do you get to eat the food of an executive chef? This restaurant is a gold mine. I'm telling you, come here and try his food because there are lines out the door.  Take it from me, best sushi restaurant on the west coast!!

iD5-pSIx0fyQRpCCCzFDhA.text: Had all you can eat today! What makes this place stand out from all of the other sushi places in the valley is the FRESHNESS of their dish and seafood, you can taste it! FDMWTjFs0Oq46h3oCk3uVg.text: Hanabi is now my go-to sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. Chef Andy and his staff are all excellent. The rolls are inventive and tasty. The nigiri are perfectly proportioned and the sushi rice is excellently flavored and the perfect temperature. It goes without saying that the fish is excellent but the variety is also wonderful and exciting. The service is always very attentive and fast. I love this place and can't wait to return!  I prefer the sushi bar but it's also great for larger groups, too! I highly recommend all of my Las Vegas friends to go to Hanabi. You won't be disappointed!

ROSteCjglY3x-wkZFaYIpA.text: Very good sushi. The service is always awesome. They make my family always feel welcome.

MI6mhwWaVmTy0EtwgjiCZw.text: Wow, never again!  This location states it is a Japanese sushi location however the owners and staff are Korean.  They do have an all you can eat menu however prepared to get a lecture on the rules of all you can eat and be watched like a hawk while you are eating.  Service was below  what was expected, as our table went over 15 mins with empty glasses.  Green Tea cheesecake was frozen in the middle and then dry on the edges, when I asked the staff about it they state they keep it in the cooler and then MICROWAVE it before for serving - I was not able to eat it however I was charged for it anyway after I requested for it to be removed from the table and my bill.

vOVfUvhYgS2Bz_l7g5hRZg.text: Dined on a Saturday evening and this place was dead with only one table occupied. Came based on the very positive reviews and location at Village Square on Sahara is near home.  Service was attentive but wouldn't categorize it as warm and friendly.  We didn't get water refills until the end of the meal and when we finally asked.  Food came out quickly - hot foods hot.  Adults got the AYCE option. Kids opted for a chicken katsu kids meal and ala carte shrimp tempura and salmon sashimi. Sashimi was $11 and seemed spendy for the three pieces.   Most of the sushi here is pretty mediocre. Not bad, but it's not knock your socks off.  The "creative" rolls like The Sunset were unimaginative and just alright.  We got an order of spicy tuna nachos. Guess we should've known based on the menu (see picture), but it was literally a heaping mound of spicy tuna served with something like sriracha mayo and Tostitos Scoops (yes, straight from the bag of Scoops that you would eat with jarred salsa). The spicy in the tuna wasn't even mixed evenly as the bottom of the lump was spicier than the top.  The honey toast is a poor representation of this great Japanese dessert. It was not Japanese bakery bread but a piece of King's Hawaiian sweet roll. The ice cream wasn't vanilla like described. It was more like a yuzu sorbet, but I thought it was better than vanilla ice cream. The sorbet was the best thing we had that night.  One of the tips mentioned the bench seating for each table. Not ideal but it wasn't too bad.  Doubt we'll be back here despite the convenience. There are many other AYCE joints in town to choose from which you'll leave much more satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanabi Sushi and Rolls - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their honey toast is King&#39;s Hawaiian sweet roll. Not terrible but honey toast it is not
Photo of Hanabi Sushi and Rolls - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry and not a tasteful presentation.

LmYgRltMhk96XLkcTo7XIw.text: My girlfriend and I love this spot, soon as you walked in, it felt clean and cozy with plenty of lighting and fun little benches that were outside the usual chairs which gave the spot a lot more room than it seems.   The staff and chefs were happy to greet you at first glance and say goodbye once you were all ready to leave. Though they did have an all you can eat for a time limit deal, we opted in for single rolls as we werent as hungry to destroy as much after a movie and popcorn that hour prior. We started off with the 007 and loved it, fresh, creamy. Then did something a little more spicy with our favorite ingrediant; avocado and what seemed like a tobasco/hot wing sauce appropriately named the 911. I'm a spice guy myself so it was well received.  After that, we enjoyed the heated Snow White roll that melted in our mouth and was clearly our favorite. The service was top notch and they were quick on the drink refills without a single issue. We stayed talking for a bit and although most places seemed pushy after a meal, they were happy enough to keep asking to refill our drinks, which was refreshing. We give this grand opening a great review because it was great service, great food and not too bad on the price for great atmosphere and a clean establishment.   Thanks for the good stuff, highly recommended, though go hungry for the All-you-can-eat as you'll definitely want to try out most of their great combinations.

photos.caption: Photo of Hanabi Sushi and Rolls - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome new #Sushi spot in #LasVegas with all you can eat and cool little benches. Girlfriend and I enjoyed the 911, 007 rolls.

ojmJVvq4jQswH_TpOGyTpw.text: First time, used to be 808 Tapas..Totally redone place. VERY FRESH SUSHI, wife is in heaven. Will definitely become a regular place from now on.

gupmC7ciQD-uiiW7AMdtnQ.text: I am not a huge of fan of all-you-can-eat sushi menus, but it's very common in Vegas.  However, I really enjoyed it here and would actually come back and do it again.  A friend and I checked this place out for the grand opening, and we really enjoyed the experience. Thanks Hanabi!  The restaurant has a sushi bar and modern bench style seating.  While Hanabi is located in a shopping center, it reminded me of trendy hot spots you'd find in bigger cities, which is cool to have in this area.   The sushi was delicately and beautifully crafted (I know because we sat at the sushi bar and watched) into masterpieces that tasted as great as it looked. We were fortunate enough to see the owner, Andy, work his magic on most of our orders.  You can order nearly everything offered on the menu, including poke salad, soft shell crab, and oysters.  I was most impressed by how fresh the food was - like so fresh, you can nearly taste the ocean where it came from.  Because of the outstanding quality, I didn't feel like the rolls were heavy, but rather light and very satisfying.  My only disappointment is that we didn't make it to dessert. Honey toast, and all-you-can-eat... I shall be back!

SLJJWxcWPtYKeuyxLvhAyw.text: This place took the spot of 808 sushi & tapas, so I figured they had to be really good. We decided to do AYCE. The food was good, but what killed it was the service. While the owner was kind, our server was probably not having a good day. It made our experience unpleasant. We had to ask for water multiple times. I don't know... Maybe the just need more help?

Photo of Hanabi Sushi and Rolls - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These were the perfect bite. Salmon to rice portions were perfect. Lil bit of soy and pure joy!
Photo of Hanabi Sushi and Rolls - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Had to request more ginger and the wasabi was refrigerator hard but didn&#39;t affect my overall meal much.

fVVtIgWbiZOT4mM_yb5gfg.text: I ordered a few rolls for delivery.    Pros: Good quality of fish  Cons: They didn't put sauce on the sunset roll like I was anticipating- not sure if it's because it was delivered, but assumed they'd put it on the side if needed for transport.  Didn't order anything that "wow'd" us, but would be willing to order again and would probably have better luck at the restaurant.

JV86JpynMoM7TVmn1z3Q0A.text: I happened to have a really good experience here. I usually don't care about the level of service I'm receiving as long as the food is good, but in all seriousness, the waiters and waitresses were extremely attentive on my visit, which I was really appreciative about. I especially appreciated how the owner was really friendly!  But on to the more important topic, food:  The appetizers here were sooooo good. I forgot the names of them, but one of them had like a spicy salmon that you mix with seaweed. You mix it up and then eat together. The flavor was so good! I believe it was called Salmon Poke. Who knew mixing the two would taste so good together?  I went with a group of sushi eaters, so I can't comment much about the rolls since our meal mostly consisted of sushi. I really enjoyed the tuna, which after having visited Japan, I get really weird about eating tuna here in the States because nothing tastes as the real deal. But the tuna here was surprisingly good! My favorite was the mackerel though I believe it was. It tasted extremely fresh and had the nice flavor you expect out of piece of sushi.  My group also ordered a yellowtail collar that was SO GOOD. The meat was soft. It had really good flavor, and I seriously wished I ordered more of it.  We also had kobe beef here, and it was sooo good. It shocked me to see that they had real kobe beef, but they even had an official certification for how legit the beef was.

kImM-SDCMeQi5XJ7kJHJvA.text: FINALLY! A great sushi restaurant in Summerlin!!  Nice bright setup, fantastic prompt service, fresh tasty sushi.   Sushi chefs Andy (owner) and Chris were delightful and engaged during our visit making sure everything served was exactly as ordered and to our satisfaction.   As sushi fanatics, our group was overwhelmingly impressed with the quality/taste/and selection. HUGE MENU! From the tuna poke to the kobe beef our taste buds were in constant excitement as every dish served never failed to impress.  Noteable must-haves: Alaskan King Crab, Toro, Citrus Yellow Tail (all of the tuna is excellent), Oyster, Jumbo Scallop (Phenomenal!), Fried Garlic Chicken, A5 Kobe Beef (not an easy find in Vegas).  Great experience. This is my new go-to sushi spot.   **As an added bonus** the selection for your non-sushi eating friends was SUPERB. Let Andy or any of the chefs know and they will cater to any request. Our non-sushi eating friends (what!?) were pleasantly surprised by the selection and tastes they were able to enjoy.

Ur3hDfM56li2A0KEYgw6tQ.text: This place is awesome!. Food are fresh and the staffs are sooo nice. They are so friendly. The food was delicious and very good price  Will be back!

Nkd4Ug1ztyOXcwMCFlkiTA.text: Friendly, super fast service and the food is wonderful. Thank you Andy.  You are the best.

qX2wGjn2aoAX2zKD9j_puA.text: The rice ratio isn't as good as other place but their quality outshines the ratio. Nothing tasted fishy and even the crab had good flavor. They didn't run out Uni like many other places in Vegas -_-. The service was great, everyone was super attentive and welcoming. Favorite roll was the Rock N Roll...no rice all fish :)

4z4cEof3czjZRHq2MnrWaA.text: Stopped here to try a new sushi place. This place is amazing. Great sushi and great specialty rolls. All you can eat menu was awesome. Great set up very comfortable and the service was excellent. Also super easy location to get to with lots of parking.   Will 100% go there again. Vgk roll was awesome. Also, good drink menu and tea

i70OCXXMn-6sMX4t5Sg3Ug.text: Amazing and affordable restaurant. Tried it for the first time 3 nights ago and it is highly recommended. The grilled pike mackerel was delicious. All the different fish were fresh and bright. Service was extremely friendly and came by the  table several times to check on us. We only tried one r Sushi roll,  Golden Knight, and it was flavorful,  spicy and really different from anything we tried at other sushi joints in town.

ILEv0DWi2gPO9uTp1mHuFQ.text: At dinner and and we had to wait 5 minutes before we were seated. The bussers and Server's/host ignored us. Then finally sat is. After sitting we had to wait around 10 minutes before someone took our order. Two other groups came in and got seated in less than two mins, orders taken as soon as they say down. One of the server's wouldn't even make eye contact with us which I thought was beyond rude. Food was great service was horrible. Everytime the server would put food down she wouldn't even put it in front of me she would put in front of my boyfriend. Then to find out the horrible service we were getting is from the MANAGER. After speaking with the owner on the phone the manager comes over and pretends to be nice, for me and my boyfriend the experience was completely ruined . Again the food was great service was horrible.

KoEfOT_4cE2-mJkdsxF6fw.text: This place was my go to... my jam Best pike mackerel  But recently either it changed... or the chef(s) didn't have it all working... portions were still decent, but the sauces were lacking flavor and so were a few of their greats... Music was even weird, it was country and pop? What's going on? And to make it really interesting.... my honey toast... no honey... maple syrup (I didn't want French toast)... grocery is right around the other... I could've ran for em... Was my all day 4.5 star.. now? I'll need to give it one more shot? Sashimi is fresh, the rice is pretty good (I'm spoiled with rice), the menu is large.. the oysters were just right... At a $25-30 pp... there's a lot of competition

larJXyIA_tovHZutptHxsA.text: Definitely our favorite all you can eat sushi place!   We've eaten here several times in the past year and every time it's terrific!  They're friendly, quick, helpful. The AYCE has great options and is so affordable.  It's also right in our neighborhood, which is cool.   Highly recommend this restaurant.   Don't wait any longer!  Go check it out.

Fr8iPf4nxRbvw7bHOHDu8w.text: Came for AYCE during lunch.  We had an infant in a car seat & they were very accommodating.  Given that there were only 4 other customers, our waiter was quick and our food was prepared fast.  The quality of the sushi were good. I liked that the  fish/rice ratio was excellent, not too much rice which is what other AYCE would do to make you full faster and eat less.  They also don't limit your selections in the menu which is a big plus.    Hubby and I will definitely be returning.  Their lunch AYCE was $20 & dinner $25.

IENXiocoRQomraGpPMwA2w.text: Food portions were very small. I wouldn't recommend this place if you're looking for quality sushi. This is an all-you-can-eat place. Although I ordered a la carte, the portions were the same. The fish was nearly paper-thin. Not very good value for your money.

gEV3gdLVNM-48XDTPPvuAA.text: I've been to this place before but it looks like it's owned by another. It's completely remodeled and I believe a new name. Is was years ago from a groupon.   It's absolutely gorgeous and clean this sushi restaurant. I loved the way it was decorated and the seats were so comfy. I'm a culinary student so I pay great attention to cleanliness. When I was going to the restroom the kitchen looked organized and clean. They had an area for storage that was covered with a curtain but so organized. It looked like some of the sauces they used were stored in scholles, which great!!! Proper food safety handling. Nothing is ever contaminated by opening a bottle and closing bottles with bare hands.   The sushi was super fresh and arrived quickly. I loved the salmon poke. It was my favorite. The price is also great. For lunch AYCE is $19.99. My boyfriend and I would drive a little ways to go to a place that's called Naka Sushi that offers it at the same price but this place is way better. They offer more for appetizers and the restaurant is so clean. Not only that Ashley the waitress is extremely tentative. Such good customer service. My tea was never out. She always refilled it. I highly recommend this restaurant. You will love it.

Yvg2qr_BhW7AMcVPRCU84g.text: Decided to try this place out for ayce and the price was pretty decent for lunch ($19.99) which ends at 3 pm. There was only one server going around checking up on all the customers, but she was very efficient and incredibly nice.   We ordered 7 rolls:  -Andy special -Hanabi special -Sunset -Caterpillar -Crab Mania -Sushi Bomb -Full Moon (Only deep fried roll)  The wait is longer here because if you order your rolls, they will make them all at once before serving it to you. Unfortunately, all the rolls were just mediocre :-( The rice was falling off some of the rolls and a bit difficult to pick up.  I had the green tea cheesecake for dessert, fairly good but pretty small. Unlike other places, you are only allowed to choose one type of dessert. For example, you cannot have ice cream and a mochi. You have to specifically pick one or the other.  Overall, it was disappointing.

gs1F_qmCRs475WoUr_Jawg.text: Greatest sushi place in Las Vegas! Do  half rolls so you can try more. Garlic edamame, Andy's roll, tempura, and their nigiri are all amazing. Must try!

Awn9xzyrENwhmoxerZ1-qQ.text: Best sushi I've had in vegas so far. My only complaint is that you can only order one dessert with the all you can eat.

jUYdnjeX72n7BCpEHq2DkQ.text: I came in here for lunch earlier today and I must say I was very impressed, I think I found my sushi spot on this side of town. I'm pretty picky with    sushi, but I really enjoyed this place.   The fish was fresh and for an AYCE portion it was pretty good, not to small and not too much rice like some places do for AYCE! The garlic sauce was definitely my favorite, between y'all and I I'd drink it.   Their special rolls were good but not great, however I only tried 2 cause I got pretty full. But I do expect to be back as there are a few more rolls that caught my eye, that I'm pretty excited to try!

jctD-vZ21DmLwfCd3pPCWQ.text: Best sushi in Vegas, quick food, amazing options and very friendly staff. I come here twice a week and haven't found any better place in the valley. Thanks guys ;)

bdzEk4yzQBd8PZQ2ZyqbXg.text: We love this place! Have tried other places and always say "Hanabi is better!" Great service with friendly waiters. Our food is always out super fast. Best garlic tuna by far.

hfCdFqq47AQ_ZJgAjptctg.text: Great place for "AYCE" sushi. The staff is friendly & the sushi is great. The appetizers are good & they offer a great selection. The quality of the fish is what's expected at an all you can eat sushi spot. Overall good!

Ld7yXURJqm-cSzPOMNJE7Q.text: This is my FAVORITE spot in town I almost don't want to write a review because I like keeping it my hidden gem lol. Most people haven't tried this spot and that's what I love. The staff are literally my favorite! The sushi chefs are amazing and the waiters, even hosts/hostesses! They're always happy to create you your own special roll based off of what you tell them you like and are so helpful when you're feeling indecisive. The price is a few bucks cheaper than most all you can eat spots. And they always have specials like blue fin, salmon belly and more! My favorite part is that there never a wait to be seated. So when you wanna eat and wanna eat NOW, this is the best place to go to!

am3rHZjaVRJV8KJVXvOGVQ.text: They have a great expansive menu. Ayce pricing is very good for the offerings. Great customer service. Very clean

z7lCxYx5YRK3DFj3v7MNjw.text: New menu as of yesterday with several new and tasty items. Still one of our favorites in town and a great AYCE.

1PePCTMkcGNQSUQ1VMu1sQ.text: Hanabi is my favorite restaurant in town. Really. This place is incredible and all of the food here is outstanding. Its affordable and its great quality. The employees are super friendly and make you feel welcome.       :)

SAScMXtBo-xqILjetwPRhA.text: Best sushi I've had in Las Vegas. Very affordable and tasty. Even when they are busy the food always comes out promptly and consistently well made. But sushi isnt the only food option. There are many Japanese dishes like katsu, fried rice/noodles, and ramen. The variety is priceless and I will continue to be a patron for as long as possible.

0waVRBNEYnht-tzoXxOE5Q.text: I went here the other day as a lone diner and was impressed by the food and even more impressed by the friendly, helpful and attentive service.  There was lots of choice on the AYCE menu. It's well worth it in my opinion. You can always order half sizes on quite a few of the rolls. The food comes out quickly and tastes fresh. I also genuinely felt as though I could order as much as I wanted (apart from the one order pp items, of course). The farewell from the chefs is a nice touch. I look forward to my next visit!

mxTRJjeM-OnmrjgIsetxAw.text: My new go to spot. When you in Vegas come here ! I love theAndy roll and the dynamite roll. Yumm

hsB5MI5jInESBna6-Tx0dg.text: This place ladies and gents is a Korean sushi restaurant. Don't confuse this with a Japanese sushi restaurant. The fish quality was sub-par. The sweet shrimp was probably old because it was cooked. Usually par cooking is a technique to somewhat hide the fishiness of seafood as it gets old. The sea urchin was horrible. It looked dark and tasted off. Usually it will taste creamy with a lil briney flavor but this was of bad quality. Appetizers were good. They were hot and crispy when expected. The place was empty at 9pm. Not sure if that's just the lack of traffic in the area but it seemed more like the public knew about the quality.

t_8oQxjIOPM3PSFVhc8OAg.text: Great sushi place for lunch. Have an all you can eat option but prefer ordering from the menu. The crunchy California roll was my favorite. Good miso soup

VkhpmzqeGveKPutllz5xsg.text: Came here randomly on my lunch break and now it's my go to! The prices are always great and the service is always on point. They are very creative and have a bunch of options for the AYCE!

TPGat4fwEUpatM26hN-Ccw.text: Andy and his staff are amazing. Most sushi restaurants greet you with an enthusiastic "welcome" in Japanese, but at Hanabi you truly feel welcome.  The care placed into every dish is apparent both in flavor and presentation. I personally love sashimi and not every place gets sashimi right either because of their fish quality or because they over season the fish -Andy and his team let the fish speak for itself with clean and elegant flavors.  There is an extensive list of rolls, soups, salads, entrees and appetizers. Did I mention the miso soup? If you like miso get it here -you won't regret it.  They offer a dessert menu with mochi, ice cream, honey toast and green tea cheesecake....but the True star here is the fish flown in fresh from all over the world!  Just ask Andy about the daily catch and savor each bite.

IMikIfiE7x8oyZgeJy4d7Q.text: Happened to stop by last Wednesday prior to hitting up a movie and our party of three was pleasantly surprised with the choices we made. We started the meal off right with finding a nice steal on the drink menu (Nigori bottle for $15). I enjoy the unfiltered sakes over filtered as I find the sweetness compliments most of the roll ingredients (i.e. Yuzu, cilantro, jalepeno, ginger etc). We ordered four different specialty rolls of which I recall the Mad Caterpillar (eel/tuna) was the best one. The service was on point and the cherry on the top was that the bill was 50% off (assuming to bring in more traffic on Wednesdays).  Regardless of discount, we would come back.

_riLl9k_Ph3lrn9df2k8VA.text: Did AYCE tonight, it was delicious, portions were large, fish slices on all the sushis we ordered were nice and thick. We ordered the blue fin tuna(1 per guest), salmon and scallop sushi. All were tasty. But my favorite was they had Salmon Kama on their AYCE! It was my favorite! 8pc tempura combo was huge and done w/a perfect golden crunch. We also had salmon skin salad, animal specialty roll, and 2 orders of the agedashi tofu. It was sooo good! Service was nice, table service was very prompt, and the servers kept the table bre-bussed at all times. Drinks were filled at great timing....very happy we came & tried this spot! We will be back!! :)

NKlevlQPwMmg2HquGzzF6Q.text: Food: My family did the AYCE at 2 in the afternoon, all the selections that we did were very good, this a great go to spot if we are craving for japanese. They also have wagyu selections which  did not Try. There are some variations that are new which is typical some combinations worked really well.  Ambiance: Great quiet place although if dining with a big party it would not be advisable the area is small so the noise might affect other diners. Definitely a great neighborhood Japanese restaurant.   Service: Very attentive, and was very accommodating with my family.  Overall: Would definitely come back and try other dishes on their menu.

l8izwk3YbPuIwy6T-ovqkQ.text: The sushi was very good along with the appetizers. I came back another time for their all you can eat sushi already.

nBxk5RE9q_tFJugelxltQA.text: This is a good cozy place. Very clean and always have the friendliest attentive staff, only thing I can say is I wish they had more variety in their rolls but other than that good AYCE place if you live in the summerlin area. Also next to the theatre!

MBEMEwgLure6COPRHwv14Q.text: Hanabi is great lil place. Food was fresh and service was excellent. Very clean and efficient. The portions and prices are nice as well. I recommend the spicy octopus. It was delicious. They have AYCE as well. I wish they would have a weekday happy hour. Would be fun to try a few sake. ;)

39_BMSVBtjBO0vVdeFAVzA.text: I absolutely love this place! All you can eat sushi (with the best vegetarian specialty roll/appetizer I have ever seen). They also have all you can drink (sake and beer) for $15... But I'm not sure for how much longer.  My meat eating friends love it too for variety of options, both sushi and hot. Sarah is my favorite server. The sushi chefs are also happy to help you figure out what you want or make suggestions. I bring all my friends here. Splitting the check is easy and everyone leaves full and happy.

7dz9rb9sqM8vr1Zgo7jd3A.text: Sushi really small portions but the appetizers here were good.  Soft shell crab, salmon/tuna poke were decent as were the skewers.   Had a sushi craving but it didn't satisfy.  It wasn't horrible but doubt I'll ever come back.  If you want more sushi then you'll be disappointed. All hot items were pretty good though

dPnkWtMQrgfNwBCTW14Xwg.text: My new go to sushi place. The blue fin tuna was delicious! The miso soup also tasted authentic

photos.caption: Photo of Hanabi Sushi and Rolls - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Superwhite tuna and yellowtail sushi

oWLVwaUR9jHMb3IEfcgugw.text: Came by after work for dinner, and fell in love with this place at first sight. Now I became a regular for their superior selection of sushi and their grills are a good pair with all the creative rolls they have. I tried the grade 5 kobe beef and the marbling itself says it all. Every bite melted in your mouth.  Hanabi also offers great selection of premium cold sakes to premium japanese beers that not alot of other japanese restaurants have in stock of. One of my favorite sake :dassai which is more of a citrus and cleaner finish sake wine pairs well with chef's premium selection of sashimi!!  Get to know the sushi chefs! They'll definitely accommodate you from beginner sushi eaters to sophisticated eaters. Will be back again!

Photo of Hanabi Sushi and Rolls - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top notch sushi! Happy Friday :)
Photo of Hanabi Sushi and Rolls - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef Andy&#39;s special olive maguro sushi with gold flakes. Literally melts in your mouth. Drool.

H23IpOGG9zBDzLe_a_tSLA.text: Wonderful staff, and best sushi in town. First pick for when we want sushi. Great AYCE pricing. $19.99 for lunch and $24.99 for dinner!

ljHWs1Prz7jADD6wmM5avQ.text: My family and I went to Hanabi and it was pretty fantastic. The sushi was great/fresh and there wasn't a lack of options.   There were even a few new rolls that I've never heard of like the Coco Shrimp Roll (I believe that's what it's called).   The Coco Shrimp Roll was super creative (in my opinion), and I would've never thought of having coconut shrimp in a sushi roll (it was a great combination by the way).  The waitress was really nice too. She was really helpful on informing my family and I about the menu.   Plus the honey toast and green tea ice cream mochi was really awesome.  The only reason this was a four instead of a five star was because a few dishes were just 'okay' in a sense. The sushi, sweets, and service was amazing. But just a FEW of the dishes (hot dishes) were 'okay' nothing too outstanding about them.  But either way 4/5 would go again.

RbFhhTwL6Tu0L9KZCN51EA.text: We were told by trusted friends that this was the best place to eat Japanese foods, including sushi. We were warmly welcomed and promptly greeted upon entering.  The layout and design is very clean, simple and yet elegant.   Now to the important stuff... The food! We were not disappointed and were extremely pleased with every item ordered. The quality was extremely fresh, the taste was great -better than expected for AYCE, the presentation was perfect.   We sampled more than 24 dishes from their menu and they were all exquisite. There were not any favorites on the table because they were all great. I would like to note that the eel, salmon, mackerel, and yellowtail were all noticeably high quality and fresh - compared to other AYCE restaurants - the value here at their prices is well worth the money spent!   As other reviewers stated - this place is phenomenal.   Thank you to Andy who took the time to ensure that we enjoyed each of our dishes.  We were also thanked upon exiting.

ATH-ALiK6G6QBK-v2CRPjQ.text: I've been here 5 times and enjoyed it every time. The AYCE is great and affordable. Service is attentive. I will keep coming here for consistency. I have nothing negative to say at all.

6ZkOLst4kAxCe_TFuwbCtg.text: Great sushi, great service and the atmosphere was cute and lively.  Our orders came out so fast and prompt! Definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hanabi Sushi and Rolls - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poppin on this cold Friday night

4LQ0ejYUpuVmpVBpV_GXAQ.text: I noticed this new sushi place while I was going to eat at Archie's next door. I decided to come back and try the new AYCE sushi spot.  I was very happy with the quality of the food and the presentation. They have a large selection of rolls to choose from on their menu. The service was a little slow, but I realized it was because they made everyone's rolls at the table at one time and put them on one large serving plate. I will ask them not to do that next time.  The only dish I did not care for was the honey toast. They served us a roll with ice cream and honey. If you want good honey toast, go to Ichiza in China Town.  I would definitely recommend eating here. It's a few dollars more per person than other AYCE places around town, but it was worth it.

Photo of Hanabi Sushi and Rolls - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vrcWRt3Y25VkKzrDzNgF9A.text: Best sushi restaurant in the Northwest Summerlin area. The sushi is super fresh, tastes great and is attractively presented. The servers are very friendly and helpful. An added bonus is AYCE discounted price for October. A neighborhood favorite and will be a regular customer.   Updated Review:  I have been a regular visitor to Hanabi, and my thoughts about this hidden gem have not changed. The personable owner, Andy, always welcomes and greets the customers and makes sure everything is fine.  The quality and presentation of the food is top notch. The staff is very friendly and attentive. If you're in the neighborhood, stop in for a meal.  You'll be glad you did.  But P.S. Don't forget the green tea ice cream. It's the real deal!l  Update 07/27/17  Hey Summerlin Residents. I've been a regular customer at Hanabi for over a year and I have to say the sushi is still super fresh and of high quality.   The owner, Andy, still takes time to greet all of the customers and is a very friendly guy, as is his entire staff. The restaurant has been updated with the addition of chairs to the wooden benches, making for a comfortable and pleasant dining experience.   As an added bonus, Hanabi is celebrating its second anniversary with some drink promotions, including buy 1, get 1 House sake and buy 2 beers  and get one free.   This hidden gem in Summerlin is definitely worth the trip for anyone who likes sushi. There are also many cooked dishes for those not as adventurous.   Trust me, once you try the food, you will return. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Hanabi Sushi and Rolls - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hanabi Sushi and Rolls - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Hanabi Sushi and Rolls - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UxPkFCBxkz6THHcHD0v3CA.text: Excellent. Fresh. Top Notch Service. Genuinely Friendly. Clean. We will definitely be back!

-Nt8whhbfbxwLcnmlVr2ew.text: I should stop trying new sushi places, and stick to my tried and True.   Easily my worst sushi experience in Las Vegas. The space itself isn't bad with a clean decor and friendly service. The fail all comes with the quality of the sushi and the combinations in the rolls here. Typically when i do AYCE sushi i am 90% nigiri and 10% rolls. After placing my traditional 90/10 order for the first round, the quality made me want to order rolls to cover up the sub par quality of the fish. I found myself not even wanting to eat some of the nigiri but i felt as if i had to as to not get charged extra for it in the end. Second round was more rolls than anything was also a disappointment because there was just so much sauce, a mess of combinations, and flavor that didn't resemble anything delicious. After paying the bill i felt cheated to be honest, as i felt like i was fed something i didn't want and was forced to pay for it. A terrible feeling if you were hoping to go out for a nice dinner. I am trying to understand the positive reviews here as i didn't experience anything close to what others have said.

Te05BeujJnM8erkC4CtJWg.text: This is probably one of my favorite AYCE sushi spots! It has great quality fish, and amazing servers! They never make you feel like your ordering too much and they come back asking if you'd like more (with a smile) up until you pay! It's 24.99 for dinner and they let you order everything on the menu!

FC7txe7hKGDiZxDpWaICaA.text: As far as all-you-can-eat sushi places go, this is one of the best I've seen. I go every time I'm in town, and prefer to sit at the bar. The guys at the bar are funny, hard working, and very skilled. I always have a good time there, even though I'm often by myself. The food is very good, especially the nigiri and sashimi, which usually suffer at ayce places.  To be honest, j haven't eaten a-la-Carte here, so cant speak to that. But the ayce option is great. Mix in a tall Sapporo and you e got yourself a great meal!

6D_Yg-dC1Az856iPiMlYWQ.text: FANTASTIC sushi.  Probably my favorite place for sushi in the Summerlin area. I've tried them all. As other places tend to lose quality over time, Hanabi has stayed consistent.   I first came with a large party with coworkers, and the owner was very friendly, hospitable, and available for our questions. The food was so fresh, we couldn't stop eating. They were also very accommodating for vegetarian dietary preferences for some of our group.   Since then, I've come multiple times and always had a great time. Service has been friendly and fast, and the food has always been perfect.   Can't wait to go again.

0JETEzX8De-6NJgSJ3bXrQ.text: AYCE sushi. Doesnt get any better than this. Large selection!!!!! Very large selection of items to choose from. Decor:I think they remodel since the last time I was here.  Staff:Friendly.Helpful Food:Excellent Will be returning again!!!!

JKMRenFMUGjS7RmAng9COA.text: My boyfriend and I recently had lunch here and the baked rolls were pretty good, but the regular sushi rolls were warm and didn't taste like sushi is supposed to. They don't make spicy salmon rolls and their sushi was falling apart--the rice wouldn't stick so the sushi would fall apart. We are avid sushi eaters btw! The main issue we had was asking them for a box because we had a few pieces left from our AYCE. I get that most places don't allow this for AYCE, but I thought I'd ask anyway and I asked one of the servers, who brought us a box, but upon taking it from him, another server RAN over and snatched it out of his hands in front of us and said, "No, no, no--no boxes for AYCE." I found this was not in good taste and the other server was clearly embarrassed and ultimately, it was horrible customer service on their part in that situation. They bargained an extra $5 from us to take a few pieces of sushi home, but they have forfeited potentially hundreds of dollars from us. from AYCE, because we are not coming back.   P.S. I also ordered a green tea cheesecake and they got the order wrong and tried to make me reconsider my order so I can eat what they brought, which was a green tea mochi. But their green tea cheesecake was hard and I do not recommend anyway.

SKiAum22BB3aV29paVl4mA.text: We come here for AYCE sushi! Great service. Great food. Drinks are always refilled so we never leave here thirsty. We haven't had a problem here at all. The staff are really friendly too.

b4nN2ZG0HikefyYl9vjzuA.text: Last night my son and I were going to catch a movie and he had a craving for sushi. We went here because it's in the same shopping plaza and I can't begin to express what a wonderful experience this was. The food was fabulous (Mona Lisa was our favorite) above this though the entire staff was welcoming, kind and friendly and really made our time dining sensational! There are several sushi spots here in town we enjoy but I can honestly say with the service we received we have found a new favorite. It's quaint clean and no wait time was an added bonus!!!

BxnUECG29VNf5Y5gRo2ijA.text: It was our first time here. Our server was Ronald, who was friendly and helped us by recommending some rolls to try. He had phenomenal customer service. The whole staff was welcoming and made our whole experience pleasant. Everything we ordered was delicious. From the appetizers, to the rolls, and even the dessert! It's such a great deal and price for AYCE. We will definitely be coming back here when we are in the area!

Op0obVcXjSuFpbb-tZkcDg.text: I just to drive so far to get sushi. This pace has a great location on a very nice plaza. AYCE sushi of a great quality, nice staff and a clean modern design. Is now our favorite spot for sushi in town.

upAD8AlcJK_h2ev42_GZlA.text: Delicious food and great service! Definitely recommend checking this place out! Jade did a great job serving us. Suggested the best rolls. Thank you!

hj3EbdpFiesYDFeWa96hGA.text: Went for dinner a few days ago.  Food was just ok.  Service was not attentive.  Waitress and a lady looking like the manager just walked around but not really checking on customers.  Place was small.

Vwr39cg-IN-tPoXuBXrdOA.text: I'm sad about writing this but as always my reviews contain my honest opinions.  My previous review from nearly a year ago gave this place 5 stars and in my opinion it was well deserved over several visits.   I noticed that since last month (October 2016) they began an all day promo for only $19.99 for ayce which is good for lunch and dinner. This promo was extended until Nov so I took a friend here and was hoping it was just as great as it used to be. Unfortunately it wasn't.   The rice was hard & undercooked. The fish slices were all significantly thinner. The fun Japanese music no longer played and service wasn't as good as it had been before. My favorite item of all is no longer included for ayce (uni) there's now an extra fee of $1 per piece.   It just isn't the place I remember. Maybe business isn't as good as they expected but with the changes implemented it can't get better for them. I hope they make some changes soon so more people aren't disappointed.

bAhdJDFj-H-mvuIm-wc7EQ.text: The food was fantastic, everything was delicious and had a nice variety. The service was phenomenal, very friendly and  diggin the vibe. Our go-to spot when we want to cure our sushi cravings.

j4Emaf6ej47ldj97GUyLuw.text: The service was great here for the most part. The sushi from the AYCE was really small and the bluefin tuna did not taste like bluefin tuna at all. Also, one waitress (middle age) was kind and attentive and always took my order fast (she deserves five stars) then a younger guy comes and takes my order and I said "2 orders of salmon and 2 orders of salmon roe" while pointing to the order. I saw him write down salmon roll but thought it's just how he remembers it..the waitress brought out the order and immediately asked if I ordered the salmon roe (I had done the same order like 4x with her before this) and she immediately took it back and came back with the right order. The dude who made the mistake kept saying in his language which I interpret it to mean "oh salmon roe not salmon roll, ikura not salmon roll). Wasn't even the least bit apologetic and when he came back with the order he low key snidely said "salmon and IKURA". Like bro 1. it says on your own menu salmon roe. 2. Don't ever think that the customer is wrong 3. Really pissed me off with his attitude. So in conclusion, nice joint with good waitresses but Small sushis( they do have a pretty extensive ayce menu though).

SPPqG91BdymodkrHDhGPuA.text: Bought a groupon and had a great experience. The service was wonderful, and the food was delicious. I recommend the Hanabi specialty roll. We will definitely be returning!

jHueOmE3Q1UDaTmBkhh-XQ.text: This place has became my favorite sushi ayce place in town. Great service and great food. I couldn't ask for more. Ladies serving us are very friendly. AYCE menu has a good selection of appetizer, nigiri, and sushi roll. All the food we order tastes great with good presentation.

XvbXVmUWoamDh3ezj8J6Cw.text: What a perfect experience. The food and service were both remarkable, and the owner (Andy) and his staff made our spontaneous family sushi night one to be relaxed and enjoyed. Looking forward to our next visit - but maybe next time as a date night, without the kiddos. Either way, we plan on making this a usual neighborhood stop.

-f2GCnHz877mdW6L2ojqzQ.text: The sushi is very good. Fresh. Okay portions. Nigiri however is paper thin for ayce. The problem is the 20 min + wait between food (more like 30- just being conservative), even when you order promptly and there are two other tables. It HAS to be taking this long on purpose. I have never had to wait so long at ayce for little orders. Not coming back.

-RApjJZRMl5FQhVSe_uhww.text: Excellent menu and exceptional service. The owner Andy really cares about his customers. The chefs are friendly and offer thoughtful recommendations. Their Dynamite is dy-no-mite and I'm a huge fan of the soft shell crab appetizer. The fish is fresh with great portions.

CzbY_BO_Me8Psk2jH5wavA.text: All you can eat is so good & worth it! For less than $30 a person you can get completely full & enjoy countless dishes! I've had the all you can eat here about 8 times & keep coming back for more. Can't wait to go back again soon!

2JA4zN61m8ZtdyQijKSG8g.text: Great new spot for sushi and other dishes.  Very solid menu, owner was a great person and very informative and friendly.  Very clean and for the quality of food it was a amazing price.  Rock and Roll roll was awesome.  Wish I would have bought the Beef Tataki or the Kobe beef.  Next time for sure!

CYnDVUqo-B9Ze3Fp5MR5Lg.text: Really good. The amount of rice is very small on sushi, which I really like. All the sushi and portions for all you can eat is very small and cute. I think it's better in that way so I don't over eat and I don't waste rice and sushi. Dessert is good as well, I love their mini honey toast and green tea cheesecake. Their soft shell crab is really good (one per person), blue fin tuna is also good, and I love their oysters as well. Overall the sushis are very fresh and small! a lot of choices in appetizer and grilled section :)

kCZZU4o3cV37A0GOBuRZ1g.text: Easily my favorite sushi on the west side. Been here several times now and quality is consistently good. The AYCE is a deal for sure. Be sure to sit at the bar. The chefs are all awesome.

s1dPYRuqO2bK2QURx1jIvg.text: Still love this place. Yummy, great food, great people! !!!! Amazing everything. It was my birthday and I could have picked anywhere in Vegas and still picked Hanabi

BewB3m6X1iMewfxha6nUrw.text: Great sushi. And really open, fresh atmosphere. However, I won't be returning. The owner/chef came to our table about four times, interrupting our conversations. It was fine the first time but after that, it was distracting. Also, I've eaten at SEVERAL All You Can Eat sushi places and they've all been really chill if you have a few pieces of a roll left over. Not this place. We were told we'd have to pay if we didn't finish. Mind you, we only had about 6 pieces left. So my friends had to help me finish to avoid paying. Another thing: my friend and I ordered the same appetizer and the waitress asked me if I wanted to share with my friend and I told her no, I wanted my own. Maybe I'm sensitive but that bothered me. And she also kept forgetting to bring out some items we ordered, so we had to ask for them again. Overall it's a good place but I've been to other sushi restaurants and had a better experience.

SGa_vsGEujjj6hqqgjlcjg.text: This place is a gem. The fish is always fresh and the owner is always here checking on the customers personally. He is one of the nicest restaurant owners and people you will ever meet. There is an all you can eat option and a la carte. They have very high end fish and Kobe beef as well as more entry level priced options. If you are craving some exotic fish he will order it in for you. We have been here 5 times now and it never disappoints.

85CHb6zut2dIhQFDD9JBig.text: This place is awesome!!!! Menu is great so much to choose from. I love how this place has so many option not a typical sushi place. You can eat all you can eat and not only eat sushi but eat entrees like fried rice and soups. All the food is made fresh to order. The service is great! I love yama sushi but this place beats it cause again the food is fresh and service is great. I was very impressed with meeting the owner as he was walking around meeting his customers and getting feed back. Now that's great to see as he takes interest with what the customers has to say. You don't see that in alot of place. Andy's pretty cool to talk to, his humble, and very down to earth. Their quality of sushi is very different, you can taste the difference. And that difference is that there quality is fresh. Trust and believe me when I say Andy is a proud chef and did explain he like everything fresh and clean. Here at Hanabi you can taste the freshness and how exotic there sushi is. It will leave a taste on your taste buds wanting more. I highly recommend this place to all the sushi lovers!!!!

h25wTt1kIO_nQ4bZcgzKqA.text: Sushi was very good and reasonably priced and the service was great. Everyone was very nice, including the owner who was more than willing to interact with us. He as well as the wait staff really wanted to make sure everything was to our satisfaction.

iHw_Gz6rV2_JT3MuBTHGRw.text: This is probably the best sushi ever, if you talking customer satisfaction, this is the best service ever. Owner Andy, are always smile and humble. Foods are always fresh, price are good and don't forget to try the desert. They have a special desert.

cLVGMayefxazEwI_EjaL7w.text: This brand new restaurant's interior was so modern. Servers were very pleasure and friendly. Appetizers were so great. The sushi was so fresh. I cant believe they r using uncommon food such as toro, alaskan kingcrab, madai. I never seen those food in local restaurants. If you really like sushi, this place is no brainer.

b0crMqppiVTVdU6FHXxfiQ.text: This place is really nice! Management even shook our hands and treated us like friends. My significant other loves the vegas roll. I love all the salmon! If you're near village square, it's definitely a nice date spot!

m3z6sRJvIkP7AlMlfInMEA.text: Was there last night for dinner. Walked in and was surprised at the atmosphere. It was very nice and and quaint. Although I was quite cold because they kept the place pretty chilly. We opted for the AYCE option which was more than worth it. They have a couple of interesting appetizers that we tried. One of the was the monkey brain or something to that effect. It was like tempura fried avocado but it was tasty. Sushi was unique and fresh. I had the red tiger roll and the baja roll. Red tiger was a spicier version of a typical tiger roll. The baja was a play on a special roll with addition of cilantro. Also tried the coco salmon roll which was interesting and almost sweet. Ended with a dish they called honey toast. It was tasty but only if it was warm because that's what I expected. Service was good granted we were the only ones in the place at a point. I would go back because I felt the AYCE was a good value for what they offered.

S0RoTlB-YnK_C70UHIYY1A.text: Great food and great service. The owner was very nice and I wish him the best of luck with his new business.!!

DoAe25xaEBF3sCZcMArQ7A.text: Great food and a price that at first seems a little higher than most AYCE places but once you see the variety of fish they offer justifies itself. I use do eat at Ohjah and Kobe as well as Most other sushi west side places but this place replaced them all. Got a custom roll and it was excellent. Fish all tastes fresh.

o4fy1p21Z7tNMIBoyYZqQA.text: Perfect!! Beautiful atmosphere and the best quality ingredients I've had anywhere! Presentation was perfect and the selections were unbelievable. Hesitant to do the all you can eat because of experiences elsewhere. You can get a full spectrum of meals for your dining experience at this location. My only disappointment was finding out that I missed out on 3 months of dining here. Great Job To Andy and his staff!

uhM3tsx4kE0EtHfAOx3gmg.text: My new favorite restaurant . Fresh & delicious rolls. Great wine, beer & sake list. They even serve a5 Wagyu!!!! Chef Andy & team are truly talented & friendly

J81EhHb1AiMP4C21Lqc9Bw.text: Hanabi is a welcome addition to my neighborhood. I'm not much for AYCE since I'm not a big eater, but I have tried the a la carte menu several times and have been impressed every single time. The fish is fresh with a reasonable portion and the amount of rice is perfect. The menu is extensive and the only struggle is trying to narrow down what I want. The pricing for a la carte is in line with Summerlin, and I realize I *could* drive a few blocks and find something cheaper, but the food is good enough that I don't feel the need to. They also have a variety of specials if you're on a budget. But the thing I like most about this place and what keeps me coming back is the service. The staff are friendly and go above and beyond to make you feel valued. Vegas is saturated with sushi places, and many are just as good as each other. What sets a place apart is the service, and Hanabi gets 6 stars for that. It's the kind of business I want support even if it costs an extra dollar or two.

aNGsaxLUPCN8Y2tvbRZx8w.text: Me and my wife are an avid fans of japanese food. She had lived in Japan for over 25 years so she has been spoiled with amazing sushi. When she arrived in the U.S., she wanted to try some sushi here. We had found a couple of good but just above average Japanese food since coming here. We decided to try out Hanabi since it was close to the movie theater and we were in a hurry to catch a movie. We tried a couple of rolls and got out since the movie was about to start. Needless to say, we went back to Hanabi and tried the all you can eat. We brought my brother and sister-in-law along with us from L.A. My wife was so delightfully amazed by their sushi. I myself was shock on how high the quality of fish they use. They are so fresh!!!  All we can say is amazing and delicious at the same time. I really can't recommend anything since all of the sushis and rolls were great. But if I have to choose a couple of items, I would go for the giant scallops and bluefin tuna. They are that good!  Andy, who is the owner, is so friendly and attentive. I can't say anything negative about his restaurant nor his staff. Jay, Jun, Jason and all the others were awesome. Thank you guys for having us. It was a wonderful experience to eat at your restaurant. This will be our only Japanese restaurant to go to. If they are close, we dare not to go elsewhere.  Lastly, this restaurant is simply just short of being in Japan. IT'S THAT GOOD!!!!

7TqVaJEQe-q8CWordMXDRg.text: I'm a big sushi person and at my first time eating at Hanabi I had one of the best All You Can Eat Sushi experience I've ever had. The staff and chef were all very attentive and quick. Chef Andy came out and introduced himself personally which I really appreciated. The sushi was spectacular, the design was beautiful, and I know for certain I'll be back in no time.

-0F3Gdhp_aRNWhBzeYuH1A.text: Hands down one of my favorite go to places for quality sushi.  Diverse menus with something for everyone's tastes.  The ambiance is great, clean, simple and focused on a good experience.  The staff is awesome, so much so that they remember us and know our preferences.  They treat everyone like family and it brings an entirely new level to the quality of food.

-xpBkCEUhNSw-ED_K3nH7w.text: Really?  This one small "soft shell crab tempura" is 2 order. So if someone order 1 soft shell crab tempura, they just give you half of this. Except this everything are good.

voIuggSvyie_KNdGfhjGkg.text: My new favorite sushi restaurant! Highly recommend.   We were planning to eat somewhere else then decided last minute to give this place a try. We got seated right away and went with their AYCE. The menu is full of familiar rolls plus many other items.  Normally we'd sit at the bar but we took seats at a table. Our server was great, friendly and helpful with any questions.   Food came out pretty quick and everything was so delicious! A little tip, they currently were offering $2.99 Sapporo drafts during Vegas Golden Knights games, so that was a nice surprise.   Seriously this is a new favorite place for sushi and I look forward to coming back again.

uqnS9Bi3lWxJP4Hhtt2Sow.text: Who would have thought?  I was in Las Vegas for business and I was starving for lunch and craving some sushi.  I had a picture in my mind of what I was looking for and when I walked in the door at Hanabi Sushi, it was perfect!  It is located in a newer strip mall that has lots lovely businesses and restaurant options.  Very clean area.  I sat at the sushi counter and was waited on by a smiling server named "chika".  She was great and explained the menu to me.  I ordered a $13 bento box that had miso soup, a salad, sashimi, sushi and tempura shrimp.  It had a little bit of everything in it and hit the spot.  The tuna tasted incredibly amazing for some reason.  It was the perfect lunch!  If you haven't tried this place yet, make it a point to at least have lunch here, it is a great value!
