Never wanted for anything and the food came out so fast, especially given the crowd in this place. Two thumbs way up and a special shout out to Chicka, our server. :-)

6N4uf_NLtRyCgZv885tPEA.text: Great food for the price!  Quality of food is great! Great service with Ashley always. I come here for lunch with co-workers and my family loves it as well.

h58x5SvqJHttM-exvmUEeA.text: Idk where to start the staff was so weird and pushy and wouldn't let me or my mother look up without rushing over and asking us if we were ready to order. Even when we first sat down this girl stood behind me while I was first looking at the menu making me very uncomfortable, they didn't give us any time to decide anything to drink so we got water thinking they'd leave us alone but they just stayed circling our table. When we got our food the sushi was mediocre nothing amazing, too much eel sauce on top. But I ordered their beef ramen and it was pretty tasty but I got it to go and when I got home the broth had separated and the egg that was in it dyed blue! There was some sort of blue coloring in my broth. I don't know what was in it but it made me feel kind of sick afterwards. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone and I'm definitely not coming back

shnwuH-skxEBshiPDW71Pw.text: We have been coming to this sushi restaurant for over a year. The sushi is good, but not amazing.  The tables consist of 70% picnic table (yes, hard, uncomfortable picnic table seats) and 30% comfortable chair seating.   Tonight we came to find all the comfortable tables taken! I was adamant that we make a statement and find another restaurant; however, my companion had his heart set on all u can eat sushi!  My main complaint is this: they MUST change the seating arrangement!!!  WHO wants to go out to a dinner and sit on a picnic bench?

tG3eDtGbRmuRTGz-U86dIA.text: Excellent good taste and clean so delicious and good service always face deliver AAAAAA+++++

c0hHeKcKIix-hmMz4z1B3Q.text: The animal style and crab mania roll is AMAZING!!! The service is amazing as well! I highly recommend this restaurant

C0oG-hmj9RXF16r6Ktz0WA.text: This is my favorite sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. The sushi is delicious and fresh, the atmosphere is comfortable, and the employees are always smiling and always kind. We always get all you can eat. Love the salmon skin hand rolls!

wgFV_BzDogbfI1Op0qoPMg.text: This little sushi spot located in Village Square used to be 808 Tapas...from the get go, the place is small but familiarly cozy. Nothing too special or out of the ordinary in decor, but a little on the modern side without getting too contemporary. Upon entering...greetings by staff welcome you like most Japanese places. All seem to be nice and helpful. Food wise, the sushi portion to rice ratio is a little off, sometimes more rice than other sushi restaurants. Food taste is pretty good to mediyoker depending on what you order.  This place doesn't seem to get overly packed, but it's a decent enough place to go to if you are craving sushi and in the area. Look for Yelp check in to unlock offers like sake. They also have specials going on on social media so be sure to check it out or ask to save on price.  Would I come back? Probably, but as a back up. Nice place to try though...you may have a different experience.

xy6fh6z0BLTJTrlBP4RT_A.text: Please thank your head server for telling us to sit far away at a table far away from everyone because according to her our 2yo twin boys are loud. We had just walked in for 20 seconds!  Her actions made it possible to have an excellent dinner at Bachi Burger.   We have been there three previous times with the worst sounds made being the little soy sauce dishes being tossed on the floor.  We were seated at the last table in the restaurant closest to the restrooms at the time. The same person sat us that time as well. She is a shorter Asian woman with glasses.  Our boys are not children who cry throughout dinner, in fact they do not cry at all when they are out eating. Because they love food! They are the type who flirt with the other very friendly tall server and wave at the man who brought our iced teas.  You lost repeat customers who will take every chance that we get to make sure everyone knows what kind of a person you choose to employ.  Very rude and poor customer service! I have never had heard anyone works in service industry would talk to customer like that.

92O6iELVA-wsAlmKNBK2hw.text: Let's be honest, everyone in this town is a sushi expert.  There are just a couple of rules you are going to have to follow if you want to roll out a new AYCE sushi bar in Las Vegas:  1 - Keep your prices competitive ($3+ more than everywhere else? Why?) 2 - Keep your fish fresh (if you cant sell it before it starts to turn, don't try to pass it on to unsuspecting customers) 3 - Don;t be cheap (buy sushi quality fish - believe me, we can tell the difference) 3 - Offer what everyone else does (if you wont serve me sashimi with AYCE, why should I come here?) 4 - Don't skimp on portions (look, stop being cheap, your fish is going rank, use it before it goes)  I will say it not the worst place I have tried in Vegas, but if I am paying piece meal instead of going AYCE, I expect you not to give my tiny little sliver of fish.  I'll be honest, the salmon tasted like crap. Sushi grade salmon doesn't taste like the cheap, color added, farmed raised crap you buy at Vons.  We are all sushi experts in this town - if you want to succeed, respect that.

EYF8qfF7dKQAsAPa2RFBKg.text: Been here 3 times to check for consistency and I've found it. The wait staff are very polite and helpful in telling about each roll or about their specials. I really like the benches they have as tables, like an old camping table on a hiking trail. It's funny!. The food itself is pretty fresh, and the wait isn't too long from ordering to receiving. They are also pretty hidden, I literally stumbled across them by sheer coincidence a couple weeks ago and had to search yelp for over an hour to find the restaurant. Hidden gem? Definitely! The 1 bad mark I have is that this last time I came in, they were actually very slow, so we had multiple waiters dealing with us, so we would order from 1 person, he would leave, and 30 seconds later another guy came up asking if we needed anything else. But they didn't talk to each other. We put in 1 order, and both waiters brought us that roll. It was funny, but was also mildly annoying. I won't let it stand in the way of coming back though. I will definitely return, they are just too good!

mac9A7i1jyypx_yCpoKbkA.text: I liked this place & enjoyed their sushi here. My friends and I had AYCE sushi and shared with each other all that we ordered.   They even have all you can drink Sake! Lol! Personally, all you can eat/drink is a bad combination but whatever floats your boat!  The one thing I have to say about this place is that my brother and I both ordered the baked salmon roll and his came, but mine did not. I asked if mine was coming and the server said it was. 15 minutes later, the rest of our orders came and my baked salmon roll was still missing. So another server came and asked if we would like to order anything else, I then asked about my missing baked salmon roll, she said she would check on it & never returned for the rest of our dining. THEN, my friend ordered 4 rolls and only 2 returned.   Once we all decided we were finished eating, we STILL had not received our orders. My baked salmon roll never came and neither did her 2 other orders.   All in all, I enjoyed my dining experience here, but I wish that they servers here put in effort to correctly bring out food out.

kyIBvRufdMO0qk-KNFLgfA.text: I had the Superman and Crispy rice something sushi last night... I've been on the commode off and on since 6 a.m. and I am having really bad stomach cramps.

2gTv3pxt7KwEur9_Do8MHw.text: Good sushi; I had the all you can eat lunch, which has a pretty good selection. The salmon, scallop, and white tuna stood out most, taste-wise. Service was a little slow. Dinner has a few more items available, so I hope to try that sometime.

oLTh8N5l2JCHWfZD2KkM-w.text: Hanabi is great for its price. Really good pointer is that they actually have a salmon or tuna poke or octopus for AYCE even during lunch, which is a plus because not all AYCE places serves that.   Their shrimp tempura to die for. Hot and crunchy. Lunch is only 19.99!! They even have skewers which are my fave. I got the scallop and bacon which was SO scrumptious. Also ordered the salmon and white tuna nigiri. The salmon was okay. But the white tuna was super good and melts in your mouth. Decent sushi to rice ratio. Also ordered miso soup which was yummy and flavorful. And a spicy tuna hand roll which was also good. But if u want like avo or cucumber with it, u gotta ask for it.  Then for dessert, I ordered of course the green tea ice cream which wasn't too frozen. It was good and tasted authentic.   Service was nice. They never rushed us or bothered us while me and my girl were chatting away. They always came at the right time to ask if we wanted anything else to order. Also I think the manager would ask us randomly if we were doing okay during our time there which was nice.   The environment is simple with tables and a sushi bar. But I do like the type of tables they had. It was wooden benches and wooden tables which felt kind of Japanese traditional.   If you're in the area, I would def recommend this place. Food is great. Service is great. Price is even better!

IN-mIyXbSN6KIQKTAHHDhA.text: Screaming "O" sashimi Yas!!! I got an O face from that sesame kick paired nicely with my tuna sashimi on top of a simple salad and the rock n roll which has tuna salmon white fish kaiware cucumber rolled in daikon with a sweet vinegar sauce to balance it out Nommmz!  Thanks yellp 24 they're faster than expected and cordial ... Im hangryyy not so hangryyyy right now :D bwahah!

photos.caption: Photo of Hanabi Sushi and Rolls - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Screaming O sashimi got that O face from that sesame kick sorry not screaming :P LOLZ
Photo of Hanabi Sushi and Rolls - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rock n roll!  Salmon tuna white fish kaiware cucumber rolled in daikon paired with sweet vinegar sauce def this roll rockssss!

6x-Zws7nZMVgFCfNMrrCBA.text: Tried this place tonight! Chill atmosphere with lots of tables equipped for large parties and they had tv's too! So it's a good spot to watch games as well. I didn't do ayce because I wasn't planning on getting a lot of raw fish and I feel like it's worth it when you order sushi/sashimi.   Clam miso soup: 5/5 great flavor. Didn't taste like it was made out of instant powder. Came with enoki mushrooms, yumm. And the bowl had about 5 Manila clams. $3.50  Sunset roll: 3.5/5 spicy tuna roll with salmon on top drizzled with a sauce that tasted like spicy mayo. They used too much sauce in my opinion and the salmon on top was skimpy. But each piece was a perfect bite size which I liked. $12  Hamachi Kama: 4.5/5 smelled a little fishy but it was soft and tender! $9  Gyoza: 4.5/5   Habachi steak: 3.5/5 had an interesting sauce that I cannot describe. But I smelled butter and I'm not a fan of that. The steak itself was ok, not that tender. It was a good portion though.

tKYoGYP3KV-zdWOc9QT4NA.text: This was our first time dining at this restaurant. We decided upon this place based on what we had read on yelp. Upon entering, the owner greeted us at our table and introduced himself to us. He set the bar for our meal very high. Unfortunately, that's where it ended.  Although The food came out VERY quickly, it was your average run of the mill sushi.  Very plain and bland tasting fish. We found ourselves using lots of soy sauce and wasabi in efforts to add flavor to the fish. Be warned, if you prefer soy paper to seaweed, be prepared to pay an extra $1.00 per roll. As the meal went on, we saw less and less of our server.   There's enough good sushi bars offering AYCE that we have no reason to go back

ZqGmKHJqDQ4CtIwcVOOx8w.text: The AYCE menu has a wide variety of food to choose from and even the dessert was included in the AYCE, unlike other places we've been to. Everything was very delish! The only thing was their hard (but cute) benches. Tables were a bit small with all the little dishes on the table (party of 4) but most of all, my butt started hurting after a while due to the hardness of the bench. Also it being a bench, there's nothing to lean back on so for people who like to lean back, they're out of luck.  Everyone in my party had the AYCE and I had the Sushi Bento because I just can't eat enough to make the AYCE price worth it for me. My bento was good good good!  They had nice music on but they could have toned down the volume. It was too loud for our conversations.

All the sushi tasted fresh and was well prepared.   The tuna and salmon were particularly fresh and tasty.   The soft shell crab was done to perfection.  Was not a fan of the beef teriyaki or the bacon mushroom that someone ordered but cannot mark them down since generally I do not order those dishes when I go to sushi.

t9S4uIsMm_eJkzVramE6IQ.text: It's very open clean environment. The service was great, they cleaned off empty plates and refilled drinks regularly even though it was pretty busy. I quite enjoyed the iced green tea.  As for the food, the sushi quality is average at best. The enoki mushroom was drenched in butter (which you would think would be amazing!) and a bit salty, so... meh.  I liked the oysters, they were decently fresh. The spicy garlic edamame is good. The agedashi tofu was good.  The rolls were nothing special. The soup was overly salty.  Overall, service is better than the food.

qIYUfvqurF49ONlCM8brCg.text: Great AYCE sushi spot. Good variety and the best hamachi I've ever tasted.  The service was a bit slow, but nothing to keep me from going again. Also, there are certain menu items that are only included with the dinner AYCE, which was a bit disappointing. Overall, the quality sushi will bring me back!

cUlW_V0Ahu0BwlIOjyCdEQ.text: Hanabi is hands down one of the best places I've gone to for sushi. Their AYCE is pricier than most other places but it's worth it. Their super white tuna cannot be competed with, I'm surprised it's part of their AYCE. All of their sushi taste so fresh and their employees are very nice and funny. Can take and give a joke, would definitely recommend to everyone and anyone whether or not you've had sushi before.

IVbur3magJT1Ra6uMHHeEg.text: My wife and I absolutely love this place. We stop by once or twice a month. The staff remembers us. Clean. Delicious food. Great service. However, it's super cold in there. Bring a jacket!

jNqMr0HEJSQEqAFYw1ULSg.text: Awesome! Great atmosphere. If you like spicy, definitely get the yellowtail special. Sushi bomb is also scrumptious.

kt5G99ANFP9x1BxDvCx0Ag.text: This place is good. I like the decor and the wait staff were super nice. I ordered ayce and I can say they do not dissapoint. I got all of my usual nigiri favorites along with the fresh uni and softshell crab tempura and hamachi kama. Quality wise, hanabi can be comparable to a place like oishi sushi also on sahara or even naka sushi, on lake mead and rampart. Nothing spectacular, but a solid neighborhood sushi spot that has tasty good quality fish and friendly warm service. It is, when in proximity, the go-to place to raise your blood sugar to the gods, especially when stranded in a crazy random and ridiculous flash flood.

HykLwDXemtQCZ_VW7C3mWw.text: BEWARE!!! Had high hopes for this place. Ordered a couple rolls. My wife took her first bite of her roll, looked down and saw a COCKROACH crawl from underneath her plate. They offered to make us a new roll. We agreed, they brought out the same partially eaten roll, no lie. And gave us two tiny little pieces of sushi to compensate. The owner was apologetic but did not offer a comped meal and ultimately charged us full price for ROACH INFESTED Dinning experience. 808 Sushi Tapas was the place before this one and kills there sushi. We will not be back to this place...

h3MC1AoZK1Z6ju_s9ZCLDA.text: First time doing an ayce. The variety is very good. All the rolls were great. The Andy was our favorite. Fried rice a bit too greasy for my taste.   Service was spotty. One server was on top of it, the other not so much. Overall, really good value and variety. We will return.

5XGHjdxIxfjWpiAuI8mniQ.text: Very friendly service. All you can eat is reasonably priced. Spicy tuna roll is just a little too spicy

UIZ4QcidZqx0DQ6pUCR0sQ.text: My boyfriend and I got delivery sushi, we put on the website that I wanted avocado so they called back., and said because it was the first time and and it wasn't an extra to was going to be for free the avocado, so we got the food a little late, and also the taste it didn't amazed me , it wasn't worth it, glad they didn't charge the avocado ...

Uio7W3I0OG0XJVlFv19Wpg.text: The sushi was average, I also felt the list of rolls was much smaller than other sushi places ive eaten at. Nothing really stuck out here to me, but it was a pleasant experience.

FmrljtxksbXvI8qvszX9Dg.text: Ok the food was good.  But thats about all i can say, which I suppose is important considering it IS a restaurant.    BUT.....  I expect a lot more from a restaurant -- especially a new one listed as "hot and new" (at the time).   Yep, I will go on about this, anyone who reads my reviews will hopefully get it.  1. MUSIC.  Im not just saying I didn't like the music.  there was something  REALLY wrong with the sound system like someone disconnected a wire and only half of the frequencies were coming out of some fried wire behind the furnace(??).  I swear it wasn't just me.  My friend who was with me works in music and even offered to go fix the system for them.  It was SO bad i felt kind of queasy or bad trip or something. Completely distracting, especially combined with........ 2) YELLING! Every time anyone would walk in the door there was some sort of yelling they did. I understand if it was one of those places that had games or an mc or whatever (they have this crap in north hollywood but this is like the outskirts of las vegas)  and also florescent lighting,  Totally please NO.    3) the "all you can eat" rules and regulations.  Im not an "all you can eat" person.  First of all, i can't eat very much and second because i don't like rules!   These rules were so confusing and restrictive.  They could not totally explain them (maybe because its a new place?) yet, anything we asked for seemed to be impossible. Also, there were all these stipulations written in chalk on some blackboards near the ceiling.  I just wanted a tuna roll with avocado, but that turned into a humongous discussion i finally gave up and got shrimp hibachi.  Then I spent a long time looking for a shrimp within a sea of diced zucchini.   On the more positive side, its 2 for 1 saki and  there was some sort of shrimp ROLL that everyone in the entire place was going crazy for.  I just don't order shrimp rolls.  So maybe IM the problem!!!?  I feel a little bad saying all this, hence the 3 stars rather than 2, mainly because the staff was super nice and obviously trying very hard to please everyone.  I hope they can work out the sound system thing.  Also, its right next to a big movie theater so its technically a good dinner and a movie place!     follow chalk instructions, wear earplugs, the theater is 2nd run movies so tix are cheap.   I would go again, but not on purpose...... or get take out.  truth be told, we were aiming to go to the thai place next door which is for some reason closed on tuesdays.  wow.

NUlZBY7hMplCfq83V2Sm3w.text: Hands down the best sushi in Vegas. They also are very accommodating to gluten allergies and carry gluten free soy sauce.

XTMeZAfYBwyPUDQ-puPJHg.text: New place, we apparently went to the grand opening and overall the sushi was pretty yummy. Prices are pretty typical for AYCE, and they were able to do half rolls so that was good. They had a grand opening promo where if you checked in on fb or twitter you got to draw out a paper that gave you a free drink or even a bottle of wine, so that was nice (though I'm not a big wine drinker). Service was very attentive and the staff was friendly. I think we'll return and try more things.

Ms6FRoPGMXbqHWQbi3TuEg.text: WOW, better than expected, Hanabi took the place of the 808 that was here, and I liked, but I was so surprised, and actually like Hanabi better. Better prices, more selection, excelent customer service. New, clean restrooms. Everyone is so polite, so nice. We will be back, most definitely!!!!

BSQXnowefEoL4U0yyWzJ3g.text: I went with my family last night to try the restaurant for the first time and I must say I was really impressed! Wide variety of menu to choose from even for AYCE. Everything was very fresh, delicious and nicely presented. I loved the atmosphere - very clean, modern and welcoming. I really liked the contemporary decor with the bench seatings, nice and fun huge blackboard on the wall they can utilize for house specials and all-you-can-eat rules (which btw the rules are the same as any other all-you-can-eat sushi places. I didn't find it unwelcoming). The staff, especially the owner Andy, was all so enthusiastic and pleasant. Andy went above and beyond to make sure our dinner experience was to our satisfaction. Another nice thing about Hanabi was that they have cartoon channel up on 2 of their 4 TVs which my 7 year old son enjoyed watching while we took time enjoying the all-you-can-eat to the fullest! Normally he gets bored and ask to go home. He didn't this time and even said, food is good here let's come back! This will definitely be my family's designated AYCE sushi restaurant whenever we crave sushi. So glad we found this place!!

Qti9AmkycpplJTm5-aOKbA.text: This place has an awesome vibe and amazing food. I met the manager Chris who took the time and made sure everything ran smoothly. He was very personable and I felt right at home. I will defenitley go back, especially for the buy one get one free saki!

VtT35xgZcRCFb2ZTvP1eZg.text: This place has excellent service. Always clean and welcoming. Owner Andy make us feel welcome every time.  The food is always  fresh and delicious.

2jYi4iMIvXh2QGKE6pxYFw.text: This is a well tasting restaurant, atmosphere is not so great had a deli like feel to it and the workers are not necessarily sufficient in English which I found frustrating, at one point the waitress gave our order to the chef he had an attitude as if he did not want to make it and shook his head. I could understand if it was busy but we were the only couple in the restaurant. Thus deserving three starts.

BubPhmdMJU9mV6YoeUyfaw.text: I've got a new spot for AYCE and it's Hanabi. A bunch of roll options and fresh fish. It wasn't packed like some of the other places in town but I think it's just because they're relatively new and undiscovered. Andy, the owner, is very friendly along with his staff. Great environment, great food, great value.

pM53aTxAIVp1Z6A6yK7xRg.text: Las Vegas has sushi places everywhere, but this was the best we've ever had!!  Sushi was fresh and service was fast and friendly.  As soon as we sat down, the server asked if we wanted water to start with.  She also suggested sushi rolls which were popular.  We ordered the "buy one get one free" sake special with a beer (which they suggested).  When we asked for the "free sake" they told us that the beer would cost extra (which other places do not do).  We ordered honey toast for dessert, but they ran out.  The chef came out and personally suggested a dessert which was delicious!! We are definitely coming back and have found a new "regular spot" to eat at!!

PhRlIRWedY0iztM5-hfZLQ.text: Having AYCE dinner with my kids. Good food, great special price!  Presentation was very nice looking.  My son loved the green tea cheesecake.

PkFbbGqH14Uuui0FEqckGw.text: The best quality all you can eat in Summerlin! I like that it's a combination of Korean and Japanese cuisine! Their Rock & Roll roll, spicy garlic edamame, and grilled butter corn is the best! A must try if you are around the Summerlin area!!!

tvuXeXNMDrzG0LrGpOr8tg.text: Delicious, cheap, casual, and exactly what you want when you go to  binge on sushi with your girlfriends. So stoked to have found a sushi place in Vegas!

DG-3SWr12tlz2NbEylMRtw.text: My favorite sushi place! Always fresh and delicious food, and fantastic service. My favorite roll is the tuna special, but everything on the menu is great!

smb7EGWG1Iq8I8jKC_nH_g.text: Sushi is standard, service is poor,and forgive me but what self respective sushi restaurant doesn't sell kirin ichiban beer? Answer...this place.

f27fq0mSsYQSmgwWlVDCkA.text: Wow!!! First of all, the restaurant is beautiful. As soon as you walk in your greeted & seated. The Staff is amazing! Ok....The Sushi & food is by far the best in Vegas that we've tried.  Very tasty, the fish is fresh & prepared beautifully. Our orders were coming in so quick, that is awesome! I, as well as my Husband give this place 5 stars & we will return for more! It's been a long time since I've had a combo of the best "Customer service & Food/Fish", this place hands down is GREAT!

u7TvcuE4cM3-HT0nI3qNLg.text: Amazing sushi best in Vegas!  Great quality,fresh tasting unbelievable service! Presentation is beautiful!

s0Fxi9U6qSoPz3B5b7m4tQ.text: The sushi here was really fresh. Larger selection of nigiri and hot dishes than a lot of other places. Definitely going to be my new spot!

D2rFxHEItDG1kOoWInp7jA.text: What part of this authentic and welcoming sushi restaurant isn't a sushi lovers dream?! Location perfect..atmosphere clean and relaxing... sake choices endless ...owner friendly, knowledgeable and takes pride in what he is presenting to the customer..of course THE SUSHI AMAZING! salmon the best!!..I thank you and your staff for a great authentic sushi experience!

-w9oFc-DLWWbzhyTd6XrTQ.text: This is a great place to get Sushi, The waiters are fast and friendly and so is the chef, take care ordering they can have trouble understanding you and vise versa. but I highly recommend this place the bathroom is very clean and so is the restaurant.

eX3xHTSbHMYKVZ4RQo8QDA.text: Can't say I would come back. The rolls and nigiri were average along with the service. Drinks had to be asked for multiple times. This is not good since it was one of the last things I ate. It left me feeling like I was going to throw up.

5Vr-IPBAKWvn99NQ6cm_uQ.text: Another decent AYCE spot. This one takes over the space formerly occupied by 808 Tapas. Hanabi has a fairly large menu with some items only available a la carte. Nigiri is the way to go here. The quality is pretty good for an AYCE place. Rolls on the other hand weren't my favorite. Some, like the yellowtail special with cooked shrimp, jalapeno, cilantro, cucumber topped with yellowtail, ponzu, habanero, were too hot for my tastes. The Tiger roll (shrimp tempura, crab topped with spicy tuna with eel sauce) was the best of the bunch, the Mad Caterpillar (fresh water eel and cucumber topped with spicy tuna, spicy eel sauce) was decent, and the Crispy tuna scallion was not good with tuna that looked and tasted liked canned tuna. As a whole, the rolls seemed hastily crafted and lacked the precision of superior rolls found elsewhere.  2.5 Stars

vO9gPTylkBjOYRRJbags7A.text: Great AYCE deal! Fish is fresh, dishes are fun, service at the bar was attentive. As other reviews state, the AYCE dinner price is $28, which is slightly higher than the local average. However, quality here is among the best AYCE I've had and the majority of lower-priced businesses in town have significantly lower quality to match.  APPETIZERS: This was our favorite section of the menu. The Jalapeno Popper dish that is commonly found around town was nicely presented here and actually had a good kick of spice for once! Salmon poke had a great spicy chili sauce, both were offset by the seaweed salad. We really enjoyed the grilled mackerel and the soft shell crab, but I did not care for the oysters. The real standout was the Rock N Roll appetizer, which is a riceless roll!  NIGIRI: Nigiri selection was ample, and fish was typically pretty fresh. The super white tuna, scallop, golden eel, and squid were good options, but I felt the salmon and yellowtail weren't that great and lacked flavor. Rice was an average portion, fish was cut on the thin side. ROLLS: We tried the Twilight roll and the White Dragon roll, both had several sauces and fishes, both were tempura-shrimp based. I generally try to be more adventurous with my roll picks but by this point I was too full to care. Rolls were solid and they had a lot of new specialty options, but I wish they had more riceless options.  The space was another sushi spot before Hanabi took over, but the modern, clean decor and chalkboard specials menu are a bit different. Service at the bar was attentive and we were frequently checked on by both chefs and management, though our empty dishes stacked up- this didn't really bother me, as they were pretty busy.  For those who are outraged by the higher AYCE price here- if $3 is really a deal breaker for you to drop your rating over, you have no business coming here. Stick to the Dollar Menu. The quality of dishes, freshness of fishes, and variety on the menu are more than enough to warrant the difference in cost.  TIP: Follow them on social media for a 50% off coupon for November & December for a la carte orders (good lunch option).

We were celebrating a birthday and the chef came out with a special custom birthday plate of fresh cut oranges. He definitely went above and beyond. I will definitely be back!

3je3rGwRLbzceGK5amm7ew.text: Eh.  I would equate this place to the Chinese buffet of sushi restaurants. The only reason I'm even okay with it is because it was only $20. If I had paid their "standard" $28 a person, I might have been pretty upset. The food just was not good; it wasn't well made, and the quality was subpar.  The service was fine and our drinks were refilled in standard time intervals. The atmosphere is slightly hipster with wood benches and thin cushions. Honestly, I liked everything but the food here. If I had to describe the flavors, it would be as if you handed me a recipe for sushi and I went to the local Food4Less to get my fish and tried to make the dish I home. Please keep in account that my cooking skills are almost non-existent.   It may as well have been sushi you buy at Smith's. Not even in my top 20 sushi spots in Vegas.

UTV7Pnl-RwPu5EYaGMORmg.text: I may have found my favorite sushi place! Came here for dinner recently and was not disappointed. The host was super accommodating and kept updating us on when our table would be ready (we waited for about 15 minutes or so). We sat at one of the tables with benches...which tbh, I'm not a huge fan of benches. I prefer regular chairs because then I can at least lean back. However, the food made up for it. We ordered mostly appetizers and nigiri. I also ordered a half roll (bonus for offering half rolls!) called Golden Knight which came with spicy crab, shrimp tempura, and fried onions. It was pretty tasty!   Another big thing for me is the rice to fish ratio. It was perfect. The fish were cut with the right amount of thickness and wasn't overly packed with rice. Out of all the dishes that we ordered, my favorite was the soy braised pork belly. It was seriously melt-in-your-mouth! I also recommend getting the soft shell crab (downside is that 1 order = half a crab). You can't go wrong with any of the nigiri so I say get them all!   Dessert was pretty standard. I decided to try the green tea cheesecake. It was alright. It was a tiny slice. I ate it in 2 bites. That's how small it was. It was just eh for me. Didn't taste much of the green tea so it tasted like a regular cheesecake.   Overall, I recommend this place. With so many other dishes to try, I will for sure be back!

9UTdNZcrlSbwaxxfnhLzeg.text: The very first time we came here (last year) I love it... I always tell my husband to take me back and didn't want any other sushi place... but the past 3 times we've been here, (Jan- April-August)  it seems like the portion has more rice than the actual sushi. I mean I can't even taste the fish. And my son orders the steak but he hated it because it was really tough and he couldn't even chew it.... I'm sorry to say but this place changed big time. I don't think we will be back. Our server which is a guy was awesome though. Sorry I forgot his name.

My little boy didn't get their ayce because it's just not worth it and enjoyed their French fries! Their French fries was great too.   Their were only 2 main female servers that took our order and they are very friendly and always smiling.   I have been to another AYCE sushi place (by flamingo) But got turned off because that other place's tempura was really soggy. So with that being said, everything I ordered was perfect! From the nigiri sushi, to their special rolls, to their cooked food like tempura, calamari, garlic fried chicken and combination fried rice. Everything was A+. Oh sorry except for one boo boo. I ordered one order of green mussels which came out over cooked because it was rubbery. On the other hand, my husband ordered 5 orders of their green mussels without the sauce and all his mussels were perfectly cooked. So I still give this place 5 stars.   I was so full I wanted to order more food but couldn't anymore. So Hanabi, keep up the good work. Be consistent in handling seafood and u will keep me and my family as loyal customers.

This place is definitely not mind blowing or to be too excited about. It was Okay , most dishes I've tasted was about a 4/10 . A 6/10 in an AYCE place is pretty good in my book.

Overall we would come back, probably during lunch time though, it was a little expensive during dinner pricing.

FaiDZ5HbspOLSgf7IKEScw.text: The food was great, and the staff was extra friendly! It has established itself as my new sushi spot - AYCE or otherwise.

You will not be disappointed.

mRJbP_-TFnU8MWAzGKSw3g.text: If you LOVE sushi, This is the place!!  If you LOVE sake, This is the place!! The staff have been very upbeat and on point when it comes to customer service.  When you open your chopsticks and place the wrapper on the side of the table it'll be gone before you even know it. Chris has the most excellent customer service! First time here at Hanabi, already fell in love

Zr5XoQTfLcNciben_DT50Q.text: Very excited that this new sushi place is so close to my house! It's small, but the decor is pretty nice. The restaurant looks a lot different than its previous incarnation (808 tapas), it looks a lot more modern and feels more spacious and open.   The food itself is great. I am no sushi connoisseur, but have enjoyed everything that I have eaten from here. I mostly eat rolls (being pretty new to the sushi game) and the waitstaff has recommended some great options for me to order based on things I liked previously. My husband loves sushi, knows a lot more about it, and maintains that the quality of the food is great. He has taken advantage of the 28$ all you can eat offer, and it was a great deal for him. If you're hungry, it's the way to go! The staff brought the food out very quickly, I don't think they put any limit on how many items he could order at one time, and he ended up really pleased with the all you can eat deal.   On two separate occasions the kitchen comped us appetizers, the spicy garlic edamame and a seaweed salad. Both were very good - I would expect a sushi place to slack a little on appetizer quality, but they did not. The cook also came out personally to talk to us once about our food, and he generally seems to care a great deal about the restaurant and quality of his food.  We've brought friends here a few times and have been really pleased with the atmosphere, price, service and food.

LH9J4NHMLMkH99l_xkBYjA.text: it was really amazing  The food was perfect and the service of the employees was satisfactory.  The material is very fresh and the texture is very good I highly recommend this store

MXWi9jIHhxICbxHIgWiY7A.text: Going to leave the most accurate review I can.   Price: This place is pretty pricey which is expected with sushi, but I paid 16.50 for 6 pieces of sushi it that gives you an example. They do have an all you can eat for 25$  Quality of food: I've been to 16 countries and eaten sushi in about all of them, ifs there's something I know and love its sushi. The sushi here was really sub-par it the rice did not stick at all causing the sushi to fall apart as it's picked up, not allowing you to eat it all together and enjoy it. Both of my orders had this issue. The flavor was as usual but nothing I'd expect with the price.   Service: The service here is actually really good, its not a big place but still the servers are very attentive and always check in. I believe one of the chefs made a round as well.   Atmosphere: The atmosphere is is nice, not crowded and has nice design a few TVs up playing sports channels, and seems like a nice friendly place to take the family.  Overall: The place isn't bad it's in a good location and has good service. The price vs the quality is what brings me to 2 stars overall when you go somewhere to eat those are my biggest factors. I'd recommend trying some other sushi place, you're in Vegas and can find amazing sushi anywhere so keep looking and save a few bucks for some good quality sushi!

WdcNJYJ9bTgaJRwCt32POQ.text: I really like the sushi. The rolls are a bit smaller than other places but its only that they don't surround the sushi with a half inch of rice. In other words, much more flavor. Also, it was the quickest I've ever got sushi. EVER! Ordered edamame with the sushi and the sushi came seconds after the edamame. The edamame came quickly. Anyway, great flavors, very hospitable service and a great array of choices. You really should give it a go. It's now my sushi spot.

a0zuph9pNEj90iurQfcpKg.text: We have been here 3 times.  The 1st experience was great!  We sat at a table instead of the sushi bar and had AYCE.  The waitresses weren't as attentive as I would typically like, but we did get all the dishes we asked for and the variety of side dishes available with the AYCE is great!  We even recommended this restaurant to some friends that love it.    The 2nd time we brought the kids along and they enjoyed it.  The 3rd time was date night and it didn't start off great.  We sat down and they brought us plates, 1 of which was really dirty.  We sent it back and a couple minutes later she returned with the dish.  Again, it was like pulling teeth to get them to come to the table to order more food.  It took about 20 minutes before she came back to get our 1st order and there were only 2 other tables there at the time.  I ordered a side dish of the vegetable udon and have had it before there, but this time there was something in it that was severely irritating my mouth.  Needless to say, with the poor service and inconsistency in the food, we won't be back.

hsHA6rsqRDuIhQ_vb7M_ZA.text: Ok food typical AYCE sushi some of the servers not so polite sitting there watching you and almost pressuring you to finish your food and get out also got very sick after eating here will not be back

All you can eat is the way to go. I highly recommend it to everyone. Just need to open his next one in Dallas, where we are moving!

t154UE8Is2z_h_3wdXQv5A.text: OK so I love this place. The staff are talented, kind and humble... That's a great combination in my book. I have been twice since they opened. On both occasions the quality of the fish was excellent, extremely fresh. I know in Japan it's customary to judge a sushi restaurant on the Tomago, my litmus test is typically the yellow tail and it was as good as I have eaten anywhere.   It's not just the fish though, they have a great menu which brings together many different styles of cuisine from Japan.  I have been to quite a few all you can eat sushi places in Las Vegas, they usually bloat you up with a bunch of rice and overdone rolls. Not here, the all you can eat option includes regular sushi as well as rolls (including almost all of the special rolls) and other options like Japanese curry and Korean BBQ beef (which we didn't get to eat because our 1 year old devoured it, the guys were cool about that which was another plus in my book).  I go by my gut when it comes to most decisions in life. My gut told me these are guys who have integrity and they care about what they do. We will be back here at least once each week.  Thanks guys for an awesome experience!

Havt-S0aFS_YmTEQ3BPfBg.text: This is such a fun experience! 5 star service!!! The staff greets everyone who walks in they are smiling and laughing and you can't help but be happy while here. We loved the variety....especially if you want to venture outside of sushi. Try the grilled skewers or the soy braised pork belly which were to die for. The sushi highlights were the seared spicy salmon and salmon avocado handroll. We came on a Friday night and it was very busy but we didn't have to wait. We did the all you can eat dinner for $25 which is a pretty standard pricing for Vegas...for lunch it's only $20 which is a steal. The fish quality is very good here, the slices are a little thinner than we would like and a little too much rice but were nit picking at this point. We just moved here and this is going to a regular spot for us.  Seriously a fun and great meal and they couldn't be happier to be having us for dinner.

LUf-_wAXtj9KsMBVni2MCQ.text: Best AYCE in Vegas hands down. And it's finally in Summerlin. Been here twice and live the friendly atmosphere. Everyone is so nice and helpful.   They also have a bunch of TV's so you can watch sporting events. Our favorite time to come us during the Golden Knights games. They show it and have $2.99 draft Sapporo. AYCE dinner is $25.99 and the menu is huge. They also have weekly and nightly specials.   My pictures are horrible because we started eating immediately. The sushi is so fresh and good. One thing I love about this place is the sushi is cold. I hate getting hot sushi.   We always order a ton of stuff and have loved everything. They even had Ocean Trout on nightly special tonight. Woo hoo for us.   We normally don't get Dessert because the menu is so big here and you will leave in a food coma but they did have pineapple ice cream tonight and I desperately wanted to try that. ZBB6h9fbylYdFskhuholZw.text: Not sure why there are so many positive reviews!! We went for lunch and the place was completely empty- that should've been the tip off. Our server was a young, bubbly woman who despite trying to be pleasant and helpful, rushed us through our AYCE lunches. She kept taking plates away before we were finished and threatening the "leftover food gets charged" policy (we had zero leftovers and I was still working on a plate with a couple pieces of sushi that she tried to take away before I was done!!). If you want details or her name please DM me.  The food was mediocre at best. Definitely not sushi to write home about. The tempura squid was not fresh, really the only thing I liked was the tempura shrimp!! I ordered as much sushi as possible (I love raw fish), but it wasn't that fresh. The ikura/salmon roe was a bit slimy in texture and tasted like it had been marinated in some sake or wine to disguise a lack of freshness. For sushi aficionados, any really quality item was off limits according to the menu (uni, amaebi, bluefin tuna, toro, oysters, etc). Dessert was decent (Mochi ice cream and regular ice cream), but there's a one item per person limit. There are plenty of AYCE places in town so I'll keep looking. I wanted to like this place but felt rushed through the meal and had to worry about so many restrictions (one item per person, off limit items, dinner only, etc) and the leftover policy that it did not make the experience enjoyable. I want to dine somewhere where we and our business are welcome, and where I can sit down and have a leisurely meal and be happy:)

Cheves and servers are very kind and friendly. Also the foods are great. We had all you can eat and the quality of fishes was the best . Appitizers were yummy too. If you want AYCE with the high quality fishes, visit this restaurant. You won't regret.

xyL5ujd3OypDfndk3Iz8ig.text: This place has amazing food, good prices, relaxing ambiance, great customer service and is by far the best sushi place I've been to in Las Vegas. K70YndoE-r-Fc06pAzXtZg.text: Undoubtedly the best sushi I have had in Vegas for many years! With the coming and going of so many sushi places on the west side, it was a real treat to find Hanabi. It was recommended by a friend, and has become one of my regular stops when choosing a place to dine out. The menu has a wide range of appetizers and rolls, some unlike other standard joints. My favorite has become the Coco Salmon roll. Coconut shrimp tempura, cream cheese and cucumber wrapped up in sushi rice and seaweed. They top it with fresh salmon sashimi and that wonderful spicy Japanese mayo. Finally it is topped off with shredded coconut. Can't get enough of this one! The staff is beyond friendly and Andy, the owner takes his time to greet all the customers and take personal pride in the dishes being served. He, himself, was Nobu trained. Any sushi lover knows the quality that entails. Don't forget to try something different here, like the seared pork belly appetizer, or the honey toast dessert. Your palette will thank you over and over again. They stay open until 11pm, so not really too much of a late-night spot, but perfect when you get the craving for quality sushi for lunch, dinner or that late dinner when you're too busy doing other things and don't get the chance to eat until 9pm!

n_N8uQ5mtX2CtopJi7gjtg.text: I work right next to this place so i always go get food for lunch and its phenomenal! the service is always great and the workers are so nice. and the food is amazing especially the all you can eat

OgMrye0ReB_EIaxMX-mmaw.text: I've been here a few times now. Every time we come service has been a bit slow. It was so slow the last time that we went that another table cancelled their order. They only had one server and 2 sushi chefs during the lunch rush...at least I don't think I saw anyone in the kitchen. I believe the owner came in a hour after we were seated and he started helping out so it was a little quicker.   Overall, the fish is good. There's a good selection of cooked and raw items.  You can also order half rolls. There's all you can drink sake as well. I liked the food and thought it was a good choice for AYCE. The benches are a bit uncomfortable so I would try and grab a seat at the bar if you can. I would definitely come back more often if the service was a little better, but sometimes you can overlook that if you have a lot of time on your hands.

f5k9RhiRZIcSliibPVOr3Q.text: By far the best all you can eat sushi in Vegas. The fish to rice portion was on point as well as the quality and freshness of the fish... I would most definitely come here again.

C6v-mZGl6uSDjUL-Mkc2ZA.text: First Review from 2016 (5stars): I took my parents here with a Groupon deal they had. It is conveniently located next to the movie theater. Pretty and modern deco inside gives you a clean feeling. Food was delicious and fresh, service was nice and quick. We didn't do the AYCE, and the price was decent with the groupon offer. Definitely recommend the AYCE, it actually includes plain sashimi, not just sushi.   Updated Review: Girls Day out, four of us decided to go out to lunch together. It is hard for us to gather, not to mention on a week day. We manage to do it today and I recommended we come here. What a total disappointment! Other than the server lady was super nice, I really don't have anything good to say. We ordered two AYCE lunch and two AYCE dinner; extra ten bucks of dinner AYCE got us extra four pieces of uni and four pieces of Yellowtail sashimi. Please see the attached images for the portion. Ten dollar difference. Rice was falling apart on all sushi ordered, no fragrance and not sticky. We couldn't even pick it up without it falling all over the plate and table. Wasabi was like a green flour paste with no spice to it. We started trying plain wasabi and not even spicy, all four of us was surprised. My girlfriends all complained the small fish portion on all sushi rolls ordered as well. Wow! What happened Hanabi??

eTiROh5xufBiUgIwCdWCag.text: Loved it so much, we came back the second night. First night was Wife, 4 year old, toddler, uncle, aunt, and I for dinner after the indoor playground across the parking lot around 6 on the Saturday of memorial weekend. There were about 4 open tables and a few seats at the bar, so we were seated immediately. The wait staff was incredibly friendly and attentive and knew we were there to feast on some AYCE.   My kids love Udon noodles so we ordered them with the drink order and they were very content slurping them up off their plates while the grown ups enjoyed a buffet of nigiri and rolls. The fish to rice ratio on the nigiri is slightly more than what you would expect to get for $25 AYCE.   On the Sunday night of memorial weekend, we made reservations for 10 people around 6 and met up for another round of "stuff yourself silly with sushi." This time around we tried a bunch of appetizers in addition to nigiri and rolls. The staff was excellent again. Definitely on the list of places to suggest when figuring out where to eat.

gB1ravcbZOLPmRlKHUaF5Q.text: I was so excited to finally eat here. Since being bookmarked and and teased by the good reviews and amazing food pics, we made it here!!   Let me just get the food review out of the way. We ordered two kids meals for the kids while the hubs and I had AYCE dinner. The rolls we ordered were good!! Honestly forgot the names, so I am sorry for not being helpful with that part. Between us two, we also ordered the shrimp poppers (bomb), oysters (fresh), sweet shrimp, calamari, shrimp and soft shell crab tempuras (all yummy), baked mussels (good), sauteed spicy chicken (okay), and enoki mushrooms (I never even got it haha).  Two stars docked because...... the service SUCKED!!! My husband's rice took the longest to get to our table, and everything else already took long to arrive. Mind you, not even many customers were there. I can't imagine if the place was full. I understand, quality food takes a while, but this was ridic! Even after the owner came out and we complained to him, he said he was pushing our orders out asap..... uhm. Nope. Same shit! Took forever and they'd keep forgetting our orders. I never even got my darn Enoki.

qq-6mpEOa6KxwEqlb58EZQ.text: Strong 4 stars.  This might be my new west side sushi spot when I don't feel like driving across the strip to Sakana.  Pros: -Small nigiri cuts, but also small rice portion...fair balance -Halibut on the nigiri menu...YES! -Shrimp appetizers done 3-4 different ways -Overall good quality of fish -They have a loyalty card where your 11th is free  -Honey toast tasted better here than at Sakana and the ice cream wasn't rock hard -Friendly owner, Andy, came to ask how everything was...also friendly servers  Cons:  -I miss all the no rice sushi options that Jjanga and Sakana offer, they only had one on the menu and you can order it once as opposed to other places that give you 5-6 options to order (and I order them all) -They had two specials written on the board of which you could have one of each...they were out of one, so I figured they'd make up for it by allowing me to order two of the other. Nope. -Haven't found my favorite roll yet of the comparatively limited choices offered, but I'm a nigiri guy anyway... -The raw oysters need a small dab of cocktail sauce or sirarcha or something for flavor ...someone else pointed this out in their review...gotta make that happen  Anyone moaning about the $28 price tag for dinner...if you do the math (and you like the place) it comes back into the $25-$26 AYCE dinner price range...completely in line with the rest of the AYCE sushi joints in Vegas.  Overall I walked out happy and I will return...

0ZsGNLfbCa-OfHgCht3xAA.text: We've eaten here 3x by invitation of friends and had mediocre to good experience. Last visit was the worst and the final straw for us. Went on a Wednesday night for dinner and there was only ONE other table that had people. That's it. To start with they brought us their order.  No biggie.  But then I ordered salmon poke. It was overly spicy and fishy tasting. No where on the menu does it says that it's spicy! Then we asked for gluten-free soy sauce and fresh wasabi- we were told the wasabi is $3 extra charge and said OK. In addition the two regular rolls that I ordered had a ridiculous amount of rice and very little fish inside. Upon receiving our bill we were charged FIVE dollars for the fresh wasabi and $2 for the gluten-free soy sauce! Are you kidding me? We paid because we couldn't wait to get out of there. The chairs are uncomfortable with no backrest, and the music is loud and obnoxious. They need to get their act together if they want to last. The entire hour we were there there was only one other table that filled up.

s-BI0MmGydqKUsuPbarAuw.text: I've been wanting to eat here for awhile and decided to go a few days ago, overall the experience was a little lack luster. The service was good, it is one of those restaurants with a team serving mentality. All of the servers would check on us and we could order from whomever walked by which was nice. The decor of the restaurant was cute as well.  I had to knock of stars based on the food. I am an avid sushi eater and the quality of the nigiri was mediocre. The salmon nigiri was especially small and thin. The rolls were okay but had limited fish and an abundance of cucumber in them, nothing too great. I do have to say that their unagi was delicious and crispy, but once again small. I ordered honey toast which was an exciting addition to the menu since I've never been to an AYCE that serves that. It was just okay also - it seemed like a hawaiian roll from the market that they drizzled with honey and plopped a vanilla ice cream scoop on.

b2QyJdbr_U7I8QkVbM6Bbw.text: Decent AYCE spot. Restaurant is nice, service was good no complaints. The food was everything you would expect from an AYCE. they have the standard fish selection. Tuna, bluefin tuna, (i call BS on that one. Ive worked with bluefin and the tuna we had was definitely Ahi. Still good though). White tuna AKA escolar, snapper, and yellowtail. They offer a nice buttery scallop, but limited to 1 per order. The hot apps were not as good as some other places that ive been to. The soft shell crab was severly overcooked. The mussels were ok, but still really overcooked. The tempura was well fried. They offer hamachi collar, which i usually like to order, but there was a $4 upcharge for that item so we passed. All in all a decent  AYCE sushi, just as good as most AYCE. they are having a promotion right now for $20. So the price is definitely worth it.

EpnVOdjDJ_yW5LViaUYC1Q.text: Sashimi Salad: OVERPRICED & UNDERWHELMING!!!  I love Sashimi salads and have enjoyed many good ones in many sushi different restaurants. Since I am in town from So. Cal on business and wanted to grab a quick, healthy and light lunch between appointments I decided to Yelp Japanese restaurants in my vicinity. I was delighted to see Hanabi was close by and had a 4.5* rating by 150+ people. When I arrived at the restaurant at 12:30 pm, the peak of lunch hour, on a Wednesday I thought it was odd that a restaurant so highly rated was nearly empty except for one other table.   After I ordered and my sashimi salad arrived I understood why the place was so empty.  Most sashimi salads I've had are made with healthy rich greens and other vegetables and a pretty decent amount of sashimi  making for a colorful, healthy and satisfying meal. The size of these salads are usually served in plates about 8-10" in diameter. The sashimi salad at Hanabi was made up of a small amount of ice berg lettuce, one strand of pickled carrot, a small clump of white shredded radish with about 6 small pieces of sashimi served on a small rectangular plate approx 4"x6". The cost of this sad salad was $15, the same as what I have paid in other restaurants where I got a lot more. After my experience at Hanabi I find their ratings and review very suspect. I know it was just one item on their menu but the fact that no other customer came in by the time I left really makes me question the reviews. Sorry no offense to those who have submitted good reviews. Glad you had a good experience but I definitely was disappointed, left hungry and very dissatisfied.

zUY1FIUwB5Df5vKDILkb2g.text: Rude hostess. 5Glg-LyYA-gQaf0867NrDw.text: First let me just say that I've been to my fair share of AYCE Sushi restaurants, and this one just did not make the cut, i actually made this Yelp account because i was so disappointed!  Overall presentation of the place is decent, looks clean etc.    We ate here on a Saturday night around 7pm.  Place was a ghost town, so we were seated quickly.  Menu looked promising so we were anxious to try out some of their stuff!  Let me add real quick, that when i go out to eat, i take my 4 year old son with me as well, and EVERY other sushi place i have been to has AYCE options for children, whether its children's pricing or just half off the adult price. They have no such option here, and my son, who LOVES sushi and seafood, was extremely disappointed that he was not allowed any of the things that he enjoys !  It was pay full $30 (adult dinner price) for him, when he doesn't eat that much anyway or order one of the few meals they had designated only for children. He got stuck eating a very plain Kids Meal option. (California roll, miso soup, and 2 pieces of tempura for 8-$10) While i applaud that they have Kid's Meals at all, i wish they would've had an AYCE option for him as well. Some kids enjoy the flavors and variety.  We had some difficulty ordering from the staff/waiter who didn't seem like they spoke very much english, which happens in quite a few sushi restaurants around town, so we didn't think much of it. UNTIL After ordering appetizers and rolls to get us (ADULTS) started, i tried to order Edamame for my son. i asked the waitress if i can get the Edamame A La Carte so my son could eat them.  i told her i would pay for it separately and everything ( Since he was not an AYCE ) and she said no, at which point i was confused and didn't understand why, so i tried asking again. To which she just kind of shook her head and winked at me and said "shhh" with her finger up to her mouth.  Either this place is just not KID friendly or the waitress REALLY does not speak English and had no idea what i was saying.  So at this point, before we even got any food i was already really disappointed with the way dinner was going. (we never got edamame for him)  Once food arrived, i can say that it was "fresh" in the sense that it was hot and seemed freshly cooked/made.  But the flavors on most of the rolls was quite bland and nothing amazing.  Even the appetizers were disappointing. Its not the worst sushi i've tasted, but it wasn't anything worth commending.  Also, we ordered my sons "Kid's Meal" first and his plain California roll came out AFTER almost all of our rolls did! Which just bothered me more...   I think one of the biggest things that irritated us the most was at the end of the meal, we were left sitting there for about 15-20 minutes. They had cleared our table and still had not brought us our check which isn't necessarily bad, but once we did get the bills,  We noticed an added Gratuity. Which most sushi restaurants will add on for big parties. (We had a party of 5 plus the child who did not eat AYCE)  usually 12%-15%, NOPE! this place took an automatic 19%-20% Gratuity out of all our bills, totaling up to about $50-$60 in tips alone.  This irked us quite a bit, especially because we did not think the service or the food was up to par with such a generous TIP!     I will not be dining here again. it was not worth the drive or money.

GUEXU38Vkzl9A_0ojWi70A.text: This place is the bomb! Staff is super cool and food was great! The fish was fresh and rolls were unique. Jun made our sushi and was really good!

PVN297f12O28a6Op8jj6Xw.text: They say the Japanese eat with their eyes.  A lot of that comes through in sushi preparation and service.  You want your nigiri to be sharply prepared, with tight rice and well cut and presented fish.  When you take the piece in your hand or your sticks, the entire nigiri should be as one piece - a combination of visual flavor and delicious colors.  This was a second choice for us tonight, since our usual sushi joint was overflowing with customers and had a 1 hour wait.  There is a reason for that.  When we arrived at Hanabi, there was no wait.  Indeed, this is usually a positive, but in a foodie town like Vegas, this sometimes means that the fare simply does not match up to a discerning palate, and the punters go elsewhere.  I wish the presentation was better, but I can deal with that as long as the food is good.  Unfortunately the sushi tasted less than fresh, and this was especially apparent in the mackerel, the tuna and the salmon nigiri - all of which are especially unforgiving of poor preparation and in which freshness is paramount.  You can understand why I did not want to try any of the rolls, which are usually designed to mask bad fish behind heavy sauces and creamy bases.  The nigiri had a paucity of quality fish, overwhelmed by too much under-seasoned rice underneath.  The servers were attentive but frequently intrusive - standing around very close by while we tried to enjoy the meal.  Unfortunately, they had to go back to the chef's station multiple times to check on overdue orders that I asked for but only sometimes received.  It did not help that the chef seemed to be more focused on supervising and guiding a trainee or novice chef instead of getting orders out promptly.  Hanabi is a laudable effort but it doesn't work in this part of town.  Unfortunately, all the empty chairs on a normally busy night bodes poorly for this spot.  808 Tapas also did not fare well for the same reason - it could be the unforgiving location with high rents, but also the picky customers in Summerlin.  The Grand Opening sign in December when the restaurant has been open since June also is topic for a laugh.  I wish them well but there's a long way to go to be successful.  My recommendations:  1. Lower your AYCE prices by 10-15% immediately in order to stay competitive. 2. Add Happy Hour specials to include generous drinks along with the food - they don't have to be expensive drinks, well-grade sake is more than enough. 3. Groupon all day every day. 4. You need to get a better sushi fish purveyor.  Something is not right about the nigiri and the sashimi. 5. Include sashimi in the AYCE. 6. Loyalty program to keep the locals coming - buy 4 AYCE and get next one free.

FoZn1kt94CQWVH6HbcsXrA.text: Highly highly recommend !!!!!!!! Tell Andi Robert sent you This place is family owned and has a very extensive menu. There's no doubt in Summerlin area it's the best AYCE sushi restaurant. If you can't fill up and get your money's worth it will be your own issue.

pTWrAxx5nV4imDILYP5SVQ.text: I ordered delivery from Hanabi through Yelp; I've never been to the restaurant.  Generally, I don't think that sushi lends itself well to grocery stores or delivery. Take out is only minimally better. Sushi is not just about the food, it's about the experience.  I also learned to appreciate sushi in Japan, where I lived for 17 years. It follows that I'm unfamiliar with what has become sushi in America. All the different rolls, the decidedly un-sushi flavors, like jalapeno, confuse me! So we only ordered traditional nigiri, no rolls or specialties.  That said, one expects a restaurant to do its best to overcome the inherent difficulties in offering sushi for delivery. Presentation is important, maybe not for showy spider rolls, but for traditional sushi. Ours arrived in typical styro boxes, with no garnish or decoration, no eye to arrangement. Our order looked so unappetizing, I was tempted to throw the whole thing away.  So, on to the actual product. Sushi is not about fish. Although fish plays an important role, undeniably, there are many varieties of sushi that have no fish at all. Sushi is about the rice. It should be very sticky, slightly sweet, shiny, and just about room temperature; neither too hot nor too cool.  The rice that Hanabi served seemed to be nothing more than steamed white rice. It had no cohesion, so the pieces were difficult to pick up. Chopsticks, fork, and bare hands were equally ineffective. And the rice was tasteless.  Any "itamae" worth his ginger will tell you that he spent upwards of ten years perfecting his knife skills, and still practices regularly. The slivers of fish we received were poorly cut with ragged edges that made us wonder if the chef's knife maybe needed sharpening. I am by no means a sushi chef, but I could probably have done better with a sharp chef's knife.  Finally, the order came out wrong. Sushi I ordered wasn't there, and sushi I didn't order was.  For the price, which was not in the realm of "inexpensive," this restaurant disappointed with its delivery. But I must again state that this review is for delivery only, and in-house quality may be vastly different. Based on the other reviews here, I may visit the restaurant, but I won't be ordering delivery from them again.

LmUQ9IdRaqOckQf5QiCQ4g.text: Perfect little quick all-you-can eat sushi place in Summerlin. If you're craving sushi and have an appetite, this is your place. Octopus poke is great and I would definitely recommend it. Service is usually pretty good as well, even when they get really busy.

eAMydMOXiLGbLFEpsOHmkg.text: This WAS my favorite sushi place because the sushi is good. But the last 2 times the service has been horrible. Rolls and sashimi we ordered at the beginning came until we asked them 3 TIMES, and then once we did get it they forgot the second order, rolls we didn't even order would come to our table, drink rarely being refilled, water was poured in sprite drink, waiter at one point just flat out dropped us for a bigger group leaving us only the bussers that always needed to get him, but the one thing that threw me over the edge was I ordered the honey TOAST and the gave me a untoasted Hawaiian roll with ice cream and when i asked for a new one it came back with BURNT stale breas on purpose. At that point I didn't touch it. When the waitress gave it to me I actually giggled in disbelief and she giggled and said "its okay now right?". S1oQFRzEoPIflJa8E7Z3yg.text: JUST ANOTHER AYCE SUSHI JOINT  . **2017 Yelp 100 Challenge LV #3** . This place LOOKED NICE so hubby & I thought we would make a quick stop & have a little bite... the interior was clean & small. The staff was nice.   We did not get the AYCE because we had already ate & just wanted some UNI & SALMON for dessert.... we made the wrong decision... we went in and sat down at the bar since we would be quick.  We might as well have gotten AYCE instead of A LA CARTE since our bill ended up being $45 which $7 short of the AYCE total.... then we could have at least tried some of the hot food to give the place some justice.  UNI $7 - tasted like the scrap part of the uni... the parts of the UNI you can't even tell it is uni... I REALLY don't want to say this but I thought I was eating in a SEWER when I put it into my mouth.  So I had to force down the other piece with a WHOLE bunch of kizame wasabi & soy sauce.  SALMON BELLY - this was their special for the day... hubby said it was super fishy.... this I'd coming from a man that critiques every sushi JOINT solely based on their salmon.... the most common fish that sells the most....  I wish I could go back but if you ruin someone's palate w/ bad uni.... it's hard to go back... the quality was BEYOND hiding behind the excuse of AYCE

uR-oObHtB-_S_puozPHu8A.text: Super fast chefs! Ordered 8 different sushi rolls and a bowl of miso soup, took them 10 min to make and place in individual containers. e-jpehSnOYEukfn4WQc7QA.text: Upon scrolling on the Yelp feed I came across this sushi restaurant so me and the beau decided to check it out. This place actually took over where 808 tapas used to be. I didn't know they closed down! Everything looked the same when we walked in though. Maybe different stuff on the walls.  It wasn't too busy so we sat down right away, AYCE dinner was 28$. A little more pricer than the usual. Once you check in you can get BOGO free house sake so I took advantage of that. But I decided plain sake isn't for me.   The fish was pretty fresh. The rice/fish ratio was pretty even. That's always a pet peeve of mine at sushi restaurants. The menu had some amazing new items that you don't usually see BUT they weren't part of the AYCE which was a bummer. They did have oysters on the menu 1 order per person but they didn't have tabasco or the cocktail sauce you usually put on oysters.   The jalapeno poppers were amazing and also the rock n roll was bomb. It's a rice less roll which I love love those! Looking over the menu again I forgot to try the Monkey brains. Dang it.   I ordered seaweed salad, it had a really distinct Taste to it that I didn't really like. I got the green tea cheese cake and it was so small! I had to laugh because I saw pictures of it but didn't think it really was as small as it looked in pictures until it was in front of me.   The service was quick and efficient so no complaints there. 3 stars because it really wasn't mind blowing but overall we had a nice dinner there.

AyOZWk9HOYuNwodTYGJ3Cw.text: The best AYCE sushi experience I've had, ever. They have all the great rolls you'd expect, plus some lesser known ones for variety. They do not skimp on the fish- all portions are very generous. They do not overload on rice either.  But what really sets them apart is their delicious and wide variety of kitchen items. I don't know how much work it is to maintain such high quality food of so many kinds, but they do it so well. Try the pork belly- in addition to being so tender and delicious, it comes with mango slaw which was just incredible. We also had octopus skewers which was fun, and the daily special was a citrus fish which was also great (in addition to tons and tons of sushi rolls).  The service was fantastic- we had a friendly and attentive male server who gave us good advice and was super prompt. The lady who seemed like the owner always had a smile. Everyone was really nice. QAyN-d09gNb6iZUJZh5xWw.text: Alright, so overall, a great place for AYCE sushi. Awesome price.  Sushi- so they call the ngiri sushi, so I will too. The sushi is always great- two tiny pieces (NOT WORTH IT UNLESS YOURE DOING AYCE) I always get 1 bluefin, 2 tuna, 2 salmon, 2 superwhite, and a yellowtail. In my opinion, solid food. Decent quality- for 25.99 AYCE, worth it.  Rolls- be careful. If it says habenero, it's not a good roll. The habanero rolls literally have no flavor. They don't put any good sauce, just dumb horrifyingly hot sauce on it. Rock and roll is good, as are the dragons. If it's spicy, be wary.  Other stuff- oysters not good, but what can you expect, pork belly AWESOME, chicken good, jalapeno poppers delicious, shrimp poppers good, ice cream good.   Again, it's crazy that they can sell all that ^ for 25.99 for everything total. That's ridiculously good prices for good quality food. The service is nice and the food comes out SUPER FAST.  Update: when I went here with someone they ordered the shoyu ramen. I tried the broth and it had a really nice, clean flavor, so when I came back, I decided to try the tonkotsu ramen. It came hot, like it should be, and the broth was nice. Noodles were cooked well and tasted like they had just been cooked. I personally prefer thin noodles instead of these thick ones, but whatever. I do have a few criticisms: first, usually they have an egg with a liquid yolk, which is always nice to mix into the broth. Also, the ramen literally had broth, meat, and green onions. Nothing else that I could see. Lots of pork meat, however for some reason it wasn't seared? Normally it has a crispy skin and then soaks in the broth to a crispy outside super soft inside that melts into the broth. Instead, it was just soft.  Now onto the important part: the broth. At first taste I loved the broth. It wasn't a clean flavor like the shoyu- instead it was a thick, flavorful broth. Both broths seem good and different. The broth was pretty awesome. Once it cooled I got a clearer taste of the broth. It wasn't as porky, though... it tasted a lot more chickeny. Personal preference, a thick porky broth is Best, but a thick chickeny broth was good too (it is tonkotsu though... maybe I'm wrong and there was no chicken flavor)? It almost tasted like a super high quality top ramen in a way, very chickeny. Anyway, I enjoyed the broth, just needs a little more. Please sear the pork skin to make it a crispy outside!!! Add a little more into the broth, like some bamboo, to make it more interesting in my opinion.

Hodmacl44EwhNUX7gKcJLg.text: Best sushi I've ever had! Best part is, it's all you can eat for only $25! This is one of mine and my husband's favorite date night spots!! Their sushi is to die for, and the staff is so helpful and incredibly nice!!

SoEkz3BhUBsKH-Rj5X3BUw.text: I always love the yelp reviews and I have gained a lot of trust over the years of using Yelp service, for the first time I am doubting the yelp service and reviewers in Las Vegas.  ** Important ** Before I give my reviews, I must say sushi or sashimi (i.e. raw fish) is something we have not tried. We just could not have them, because my wife was pregnant.  Ambience Nice and clean restaurant with a lot of screens, maybe little too many. ****  Service Generally pay attention to our table good. We were in at 3pm so with very few tables to serve, that is expected, but still nice. However, I was shock with what server said. One of the food that we ordered was Cold Soba, after 5 minutes, the server comes back and says "sorry we are short on cold soup so we will not be able to make Cold Soba" this was something that my wife really wanted or the baby inside really wanted lol she then continued by saying "the one on desert inn is good for this" To me it sounded like "no one order those and you should go to that one, if you want Cold Soba" Just sounded very rude. **  Food We ordered Cold Soba, Japanese Hamburger Steak and Baked Salmon Roll. As I mentioned above we ordered Cold Soba, but it wasn't available so we cancelled the order. Japanese Hamburger Steak, we ordered well-done because of pregnant wife. The food came out burnt on the outside and very salty. What does this mean? Instead of cooking in the medium heat for more well-done inside and not burnt outside, they cooked in full flame. Salty means, they just cooked it for longer period of time to get it more cooked without changing any level of sodium or adding water. Hence mushroom and onion that were with the meat was also salty. Baked Salmon Roll had some more expensive ingredients in it, such as cream cheese, salmon and some more cheese on top, but again they could not balanced the flavours. Other side dishes were not best either. Wasabi was pretty low quality or was not stored in right temperature. Iced green tea was green coloured iced water instead of tasting green tea. Salad was fresh, but too much dressing. Overall, the food here is a kind of food that you would find in a mall food court, no expertise or love in cooking. *  Price Japanese Hamburger Steak should be sufficient for $4 Baked Salmon Roll should be sufficient for $6 just because there are some higher priced ingredient in it. So total bill with tip should have been about $14, but instead the bill was over $30 *  Recommend for People who loves watching sports (if they use the TVs as watching sports) and just eating sushi as finger food in unlimited sushi. ($22 for lunch $28 for dinner) Sushi cannot be too bad if they are using sushi rice making machine and putting fish on top.
